      <script src="../../resources/js/dbmodnizr.js" type="text/javascript"/>
      <title>A Midsummer Night's Dream</title>
   </head>

            <h1>A Midsummer Night's Dream</h1>
         </header>

                           </span>
                        </li>

                  </li>

            </div>
         </div>
         <article class="preface" id="R.1.2">
            <header class="preface-titlepage">
               <h2>Dramatis Personae</h2>
            </header>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">THESEUS, Duke of Athens.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">EGEUS, father to Hermia.</span>
            </p>
            <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
               <tr>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">
                        <span class="personname">LYSANDER</span>
                        <span class="personname">DEMETRIUS</span>
                     </span>
                  </td>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">in love with Hermia.</span>
                  </td>
               </tr>
            </table>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">PHILOSTRATE, master of the revels to Theseus.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">QUINCE, a carpenter.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">SNUG, a joiner.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">BOTTOM, a weaver.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">FLUTE, a bellows-mender.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">SNOUT, a tinker.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">STARVELING, a tailor.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">HIPPOLYTA, queen of the Amazons, betrothed to Theseus.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">HERMIA, daughter to Egeus, in love with Lysander.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">HELENA, in love with Demetrius.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">OBERON, king of the fairies.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">TITANIA, queen of the fairies.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">PUCK, or Robin Goodfellow.</span>
            </p>
            <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
               <tr>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">
                        <span class="personname">PEASEBLOSSOM</span>
                        <span class="personname">COBWEB</span>
                        <span class="personname">MOTH</span>
                        <span class="personname">MUSTARDSEED</span>
                     </span>
                  </td>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">fairies.</span>
                  </td>
               </tr>
            </table>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">Other fairies attending their King and Queen.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">Attendants on Theseus and Hippolyta.</span>
            </p>
            <p>SCENE  Athens, and a wood near it.</p>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.3">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 1. ACT I</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.3.2">1. SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.3.3">2. SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.3.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter THESEUS, HIPPOLYTA, PHILOSTRATE, and
Attendants</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THESEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, fair Hippolyta, our nuptial hour</div>
                     <div class="line">Draws on apace; four happy days bring in</div>
                     <div class="line">Another moon: but, O, methinks, how slow</div>
                     <div class="line">This old moon wanes! she lingers my desires,</div>
                     <div class="line">Like to a step-dame or a dowager</div>
                     <div class="line">Long withering out a young man revenue.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HIPPOLYTA</div>
                     <div class="line">Four days will quickly steep themselves in night;</div>
                     <div class="line">Four nights will quickly dream away the time;</div>
                     <div class="line">And then the moon, like to a silver bow</div>
                     <div class="line">New-bent in heaven, shall behold the night</div>
                     <div class="line">Of our solemnities.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THESEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Go, Philostrate,</div>
                     <div class="line">Stir up the Athenian youth to merriments;</div>
                     <div class="line">Awake the pert and nimble spirit of mirth;</div>
                     <div class="line">Turn melancholy forth to funerals;</div>
                     <div class="line">The pale companion is not for our pomp.</div>
                     <p>Exit PHILOSTRATE</p>
                     <div class="line">Hippolyta, I woo'd thee with my sword,</div>
                     <div class="line">And won thy love, doing thee injuries;</div>
                     <div class="line">But I will wed thee in another key,</div>
                     <div class="line">With pomp, with triumph and with revelling.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter EGEUS, HERMIA, LYSANDER, and DEMETRIUS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EGEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Happy be Theseus, our renowned duke!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THESEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Thanks, good Egeus: what's the news with thee?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EGEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Full of vexation come I, with complaint</div>
                     <div class="line">Against my child, my daughter Hermia.</div>
                     <div class="line">Stand forth, Demetrius. My noble lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">This man hath my consent to marry her.</div>
                     <div class="line">Stand forth, Lysander: and my gracious duke,</div>
                     <div class="line">This man hath bewitch'd the bosom of my child;</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou, thou, Lysander, thou hast given her rhymes,</div>
                     <div class="line">And interchanged love-tokens with my child:</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou hast by moonlight at her window sung,</div>
                     <div class="line">With feigning voice verses of feigning love,</div>
                     <div class="line">And stolen the impression of her fantasy</div>
                     <div class="line">With bracelets of thy hair, rings, gawds, conceits,</div>
                     <div class="line">Knacks, trifles, nosegays, sweetmeats, messengers</div>
                     <div class="line">Of strong prevailment in unharden'd youth:</div>
                     <div class="line">With cunning hast thou filch'd my daughter's heart,</div>
                     <div class="line">Turn'd her obedience, which is due to me,</div>
                     <div class="line">To stubborn harshness: and, my gracious duke,</div>
                     <div class="line">Be it so she; will not here before your grace</div>
                     <div class="line">Consent to marry with Demetrius,</div>
                     <div class="line">I beg the ancient privilege of Athens,</div>
                     <div class="line">As she is mine, I may dispose of her:</div>
                     <div class="line">Which shall be either to this gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">Or to her death, according to our law</div>
                     <div class="line">Immediately provided in that case.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THESEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">What say you, Hermia? be advised fair maid:</div>
                     <div class="line">To you your father should be as a god;</div>
                     <div class="line">One that composed your beauties, yea, and one</div>
                     <div class="line">To whom you are but as a form in wax</div>
                     <div class="line">By him imprinted and within his power</div>
                     <div class="line">To leave the figure or disfigure it.</div>
                     <div class="line">Demetrius is a worthy gentleman.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HERMIA</div>
                     <div class="line">So is Lysander.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THESEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">In himself he is;</div>
                     <div class="line">But in this kind, wanting your father's voice,</div>
                     <div class="line">The other must be held the worthier.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HERMIA</div>
                     <div class="line">I would my father look'd but with my eyes.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THESEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Rather your eyes must with his judgment look.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HERMIA</div>
                     <div class="line">I do entreat your grace to pardon me.</div>
                     <div class="line">I know not by what power I am made bold,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor how it may concern my modesty,</div>
                     <div class="line">In such a presence here to plead my thoughts;</div>
                     <div class="line">But I beseech your grace that I may know</div>
                     <div class="line">The worst that may befall me in this case,</div>
                     <div class="line">If I refuse to wed Demetrius.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THESEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Either to die the death or to abjure</div>
                     <div class="line">For ever the society of men.</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore, fair Hermia, question your desires;</div>
                     <div class="line">Know of your youth, examine well your blood,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whether, if you yield not to your father's choice,</div>
                     <div class="line">You can endure the livery of a nun,</div>
                     <div class="line">For aye to be in shady cloister mew'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">To live a barren sister all your life,</div>
                     <div class="line">Chanting faint hymns to the cold fruitless moon.</div>
                     <div class="line">Thrice-blessed they that master so their blood,</div>
                     <div class="line">To undergo such maiden pilgrimage;</div>
                     <div class="line">But earthlier happy is the rose distill'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">Than that which withering on the virgin thorn</div>
                     <div class="line">Grows, lives and dies in single blessedness.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HERMIA</div>
                     <div class="line">So will I grow, so live, so die, my lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">Ere I will my virgin patent up</div>
                     <div class="line">Unto his lordship, whose unwished yoke</div>
                     <div class="line">My soul consents not to give sovereignty.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THESEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Take time to pause; and, by the nest new moon--</div>
                     <div class="line">The sealing-day betwixt my love and me,</div>
                     <div class="line">For everlasting bond of fellowship--</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon that day either prepare to die</div>
                     <div class="line">For disobedience to your father's will,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or else to wed Demetrius, as he would;</div>
                     <div class="line">Or on Diana's altar to protest</div>
                     <div class="line">For aye austerity and single life.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DEMETRIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Relent, sweet Hermia: and, Lysander, yield</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy crazed title to my certain right.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LYSANDER</div>
                     <div class="line">You have her father's love, Demetrius;</div>
                     <div class="line">Let me have Hermia's: do you marry him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EGEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Scornful Lysander! true, he hath my love,</div>
                     <div class="line">And what is mine my love shall render him.</div>
                     <div class="line">And she is mine, and all my right of her</div>
                     <div class="line">I do estate unto Demetrius.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LYSANDER</div>
                     <div class="line">I am, my lord, as well derived as he,</div>
                     <div class="line">As well possess'd; my love is more than his;</div>
                     <div class="line">My fortunes every way as fairly rank'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">If not with vantage, as Demetrius';</div>
                     <div class="line">And, which is more than all these boasts can be,</div>
                     <div class="line">I am beloved of beauteous Hermia:</div>
                     <div class="line">Why should not I then prosecute my right?</div>
                     <div class="line">Demetrius, I'll avouch it to his head,</div>
                     <div class="line">Made love to Nedar's daughter, Helena,</div>
                     <div class="line">And won her soul; and she, sweet lady, dotes,</div>
                     <div class="line">Devoutly dotes, dotes in idolatry,</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon this spotted and inconstant man.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THESEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I must confess that I have heard so much,</div>
                     <div class="line">And with Demetrius thought to have spoke thereof;</div>
                     <div class="line">But, being over-full of self-affairs,</div>
                     <div class="line">My mind did lose it. But, Demetrius, come;</div>
                     <div class="line">And come, Egeus; you shall go with me,</div>
                     <div class="line">I have some private schooling for you both.</div>
                     <div class="line">For you, fair Hermia, look you arm yourself</div>
                     <div class="line">To fit your fancies to your father's will;</div>
                     <div class="line">Or else the law of Athens yields you up--</div>
                     <div class="line">Which by no means we may extenuate--</div>
                     <div class="line">To death, or to a vow of single life.</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, my Hippolyta: what cheer, my love?</div>
                     <div class="line">Demetrius and Egeus, go along:</div>
                     <div class="line">I must employ you in some business</div>
                     <div class="line">Against our nuptial and confer with you</div>
                     <div class="line">Of something nearly that concerns yourselves.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">EGEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">With duty and desire we follow you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt all but LYSANDER and HERMIA</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LYSANDER</div>
                     <div class="line">How now, my love! why is your cheek so pale?</div>
                     <div class="line">How chance the roses there do fade so fast?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HERMIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Belike for want of rain, which I could well</div>
                     <div class="line">Beteem them from the tempest of my eyes.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LYSANDER</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay me! for aught that I could ever read,</div>
                     <div class="line">Could ever hear by tale or history,</div>
                     <div class="line">The course of true love never did run smooth;</div>
                     <div class="line">But, either it was different in blood,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HERMIA</div>
                     <div class="line">O cross! too high to be enthrall'd to low.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LYSANDER</div>
                     <div class="line">Or else misgraffed in respect of years,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HERMIA</div>
                     <div class="line">O spite! too old to be engaged to young.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LYSANDER</div>
                     <div class="line">Or else it stood upon the choice of friends,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HERMIA</div>
                     <div class="line">O hell! to choose love by another's eyes.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LYSANDER</div>
                     <div class="line">Or, if there were a sympathy in choice,</div>
                     <div class="line">War, death, or sickness did lay siege to it,</div>
                     <div class="line">Making it momentany as a sound,</div>
                     <div class="line">Swift as a shadow, short as any dream;</div>
                     <div class="line">Brief as the lightning in the collied night,</div>
                     <div class="line">That, in a spleen, unfolds both heaven and earth,</div>
                     <div class="line">And ere a man hath power to say 'Behold!'</div>
                     <div class="line">The jaws of darkness do devour it up:</div>
                     <div class="line">So quick bright things come to confusion.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HERMIA</div>
                     <div class="line">If then true lovers have been ever cross'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">It stands as an edict in destiny:</div>
                     <div class="line">Then let us teach our trial patience,</div>
                     <div class="line">Because it is a customary cross,</div>
                     <div class="line">As due to love as thoughts and dreams and sighs,</div>
                     <div class="line">Wishes and tears, poor fancy's followers.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LYSANDER</div>
                     <div class="line">A good persuasion: therefore, hear me, Hermia.</div>
                     <div class="line">I have a widow aunt, a dowager</div>
                     <div class="line">Of great revenue, and she hath no child:</div>
                     <div class="line">From Athens is her house remote seven leagues;</div>
                     <div class="line">And she respects me as her only son.</div>
                     <div class="line">There, gentle Hermia, may I marry thee;</div>
                     <div class="line">And to that place the sharp Athenian law</div>
                     <div class="line">Cannot pursue us. If thou lovest me then,</div>
                     <div class="line">Steal forth thy father's house to-morrow night;</div>
                     <div class="line">And in the wood, a league without the town,</div>
                     <div class="line">Where I did meet thee once with Helena,</div>
                     <div class="line">To do observance to a morn of May,</div>
                     <div class="line">There will I stay for thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HERMIA</div>
                     <div class="line">My good Lysander!</div>
                     <div class="line">I swear to thee, by Cupid's strongest bow,</div>
                     <div class="line">By his best arrow with the golden head,</div>
                     <div class="line">By the simplicity of Venus' doves,</div>
                     <div class="line">By that which knitteth souls and prospers loves,</div>
                     <div class="line">And by that fire which burn'd the Carthage queen,</div>
                     <div class="line">When the false Troyan under sail was seen,</div>
                     <div class="line">By all the vows that ever men have broke,</div>
                     <div class="line">In number more than ever women spoke,</div>
                     <div class="line">In that same place thou hast appointed me,</div>
                     <div class="line">To-morrow truly will I meet with thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LYSANDER</div>
                     <div class="line">Keep promise, love. Look, here comes Helena.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter HELENA</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HERMIA</div>
                     <div class="line">God speed fair Helena! whither away?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">Call you me fair? that fair again unsay.</div>
                     <div class="line">Demetrius loves your fair: O happy fair!</div>
                     <div class="line">Your eyes are lode-stars; and your tongue's sweet air</div>
                     <div class="line">More tuneable than lark to shepherd's ear,</div>
                     <div class="line">When wheat is green, when hawthorn buds appear.</div>
                     <div class="line">Sickness is catching: O, were favour so,</div>
                     <div class="line">Yours would I catch, fair Hermia, ere I go;</div>
                     <div class="line">My ear should catch your voice, my eye your eye,</div>
                     <div class="line">My tongue should catch your tongue's sweet melody.</div>
                     <div class="line">Were the world mine, Demetrius being bated,</div>
                     <div class="line">The rest I'd give to be to you translated.</div>
                     <div class="line">O, teach me how you look, and with what art</div>
                     <div class="line">You sway the motion of Demetrius' heart.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HERMIA</div>
                     <div class="line">I frown upon him, yet he loves me still.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">O that your frowns would teach my smiles such skill!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HERMIA</div>
                     <div class="line">I give him curses, yet he gives me love.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">O that my prayers could such affection move!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HERMIA</div>
                     <div class="line">The more I hate, the more he follows me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">The more I love, the more he hateth me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HERMIA</div>
                     <div class="line">His folly, Helena, is no fault of mine.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">None, but your beauty: would that fault were mine!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HERMIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Take comfort: he no more shall see my face;</div>
                     <div class="line">Lysander and myself will fly this place.</div>
                     <div class="line">Before the time I did Lysander see,</div>
                     <div class="line">Seem'd Athens as a paradise to me:</div>
                     <div class="line">O, then, what graces in my love do dwell,</div>
                     <div class="line">That he hath turn'd a heaven unto a hell!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LYSANDER</div>
                     <div class="line">Helen, to you our minds we will unfold:</div>
                     <div class="line">To-morrow night, when Phoebe doth behold</div>
                     <div class="line">Her silver visage in the watery glass,</div>
                     <div class="line">Decking with liquid pearl the bladed grass,</div>
                     <div class="line">A time that lovers' flights doth still conceal,</div>
                     <div class="line">Through Athens' gates have we devised to steal.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HERMIA</div>
                     <div class="line">And in the wood, where often you and I</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon faint primrose-beds were wont to lie,</div>
                     <div class="line">Emptying our bosoms of their counsel sweet,</div>
                     <div class="line">There my Lysander and myself shall meet;</div>
                     <div class="line">And thence from Athens turn away our eyes,</div>
                     <div class="line">To seek new friends and stranger companies.</div>
                     <div class="line">Farewell, sweet playfellow: pray thou for us;</div>
                     <div class="line">And good luck grant thee thy Demetrius!</div>
                     <div class="line">Keep word, Lysander: we must starve our sight</div>
                     <div class="line">From lovers' food till morrow deep midnight.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LYSANDER</div>
                     <div class="line">I will, my Hermia.</div>
                     <p>Exit HERMIA</p>
                     <div class="line">Helena, adieu:</div>
                     <div class="line">As you on him, Demetrius dote on you!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">How happy some o'er other some can be!</div>
                     <div class="line">Through Athens I am thought as fair as she.</div>
                     <div class="line">But what of that? Demetrius thinks not so;</div>
                     <div class="line">He will not know what all but he do know:</div>
                     <div class="line">And as he errs, doting on Hermia's eyes,</div>
                     <div class="line">So I, admiring of his qualities:</div>
                     <div class="line">Things base and vile, folding no quantity,</div>
                     <div class="line">Love can transpose to form and dignity:</div>
                     <div class="line">Love looks not with the eyes, but with the mind;</div>
                     <div class="line">And therefore is wing'd Cupid painted blind:</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor hath Love's mind of any judgement taste;</div>
                     <div class="line">Wings and no eyes figure unheedy haste:</div>
                     <div class="line">And therefore is Love said to be a child,</div>
                     <div class="line">Because in choice he is so oft beguiled.</div>
                     <div class="line">As waggish boys in game themselves forswear,</div>
                     <div class="line">So the boy Love is perjured every where:</div>
                     <div class="line">For ere Demetrius look'd on Hermia's eyne,</div>
                     <div class="line">He hail'd down oaths that he was only mine;</div>
                     <div class="line">And when this hail some heat from Hermia felt,</div>
                     <div class="line">So he dissolved, and showers of oaths did melt.</div>
                     <div class="line">I will go tell him of fair Hermia's flight:</div>
                     <div class="line">Then to the wood will he to-morrow night</div>
                     <div class="line">Pursue her; and for this intelligence</div>
                     <div class="line">If I have thanks, it is a dear expense:</div>
                     <div class="line">But herein mean I to enrich my pain,</div>
                     <div class="line">To have his sight thither and back again.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.3.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter QUINCE, SNUG, BOTTOM, FLUTE, SNOUT, and
STARVELING</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUINCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Is all our company here?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOTTOM</div>
                     <div class="line">You were best to call them generally, man by man,</div>
                     <div class="line">according to the scrip.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUINCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Here is the scroll of every man's name, which is</div>
                     <div class="line">thought fit, through all Athens, to play in our</div>
                     <div class="line">interlude before the duke and the duchess, on his</div>
                     <div class="line">wedding-day at night.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOTTOM</div>
                     <div class="line">First, good Peter Quince, say what the play treats</div>
                     <div class="line">on, then read the names of the actors, and so grow</div>
                     <div class="line">to a point.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUINCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, our play is, The most lamentable comedy, and</div>
                     <div class="line">most cruel death of Pyramus and Thisby.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOTTOM</div>
                     <div class="line">A very good piece of work, I assure you, and a</div>
                     <div class="line">merry. Now, good Peter Quince, call forth your</div>
                     <div class="line">actors by the scroll. Masters, spread yourselves.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUINCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Answer as I call you. Nick Bottom, the weaver.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOTTOM</div>
                     <div class="line">Ready. Name what part I am for, and proceed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUINCE</div>
                     <div class="line">You, Nick Bottom, are set down for Pyramus.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOTTOM</div>
                     <div class="line">What is Pyramus? a lover, or a tyrant?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUINCE</div>
                     <div class="line">A lover, that kills himself most gallant for love.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOTTOM</div>
                     <div class="line">That will ask some tears in the true performing of</div>
                     <div class="line">it: if I do it, let the audience look to their</div>
                     <div class="line">eyes; I will move storms, I will condole in some</div>
                     <div class="line">measure. To the rest: yet my chief humour is for a</div>
                     <div class="line">tyrant: I could play Ercles rarely, or a part to</div>
                     <div class="line">tear a cat in, to make all split.</div>
                     <div class="line">The raging rocks</div>
                     <div class="line">And shivering shocks</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall break the locks</div>
                     <div class="line">Of prison gates;</div>
                     <div class="line">And Phibbus' car</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall shine from far</div>
                     <div class="line">And make and mar</div>
                     <div class="line">The foolish Fates.</div>
                     <div class="line">This was lofty! Now name the rest of the players.</div>
                     <div class="line">This is Ercles' vein, a tyrant's vein; a lover is</div>
                     <div class="line">more condoling.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUINCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Francis Flute, the bellows-mender.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FLUTE</div>
                     <div class="line">Here, Peter Quince.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUINCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Flute, you must take Thisby on you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FLUTE</div>
                     <div class="line">What is Thisby? a wandering knight?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUINCE</div>
                     <div class="line">It is the lady that Pyramus must love.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FLUTE</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, faith, let me not play a woman; I have a beard coming.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUINCE</div>
                     <div class="line">That's all one: you shall play it in a mask, and</div>
                     <div class="line">you may speak as small as you will.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOTTOM</div>
                     <div class="line">An I may hide my face, let me play Thisby too, I'll</div>
                     <div class="line">speak in a monstrous little voice. 'Thisne,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thisne;' 'Ah, Pyramus, lover dear! thy Thisby dear,</div>
                     <div class="line">and lady dear!'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUINCE</div>
                     <div class="line">No, no; you must play Pyramus: and, Flute, you Thisby.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOTTOM</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, proceed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUINCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Robin Starveling, the tailor.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">STARVELING</div>
                     <div class="line">Here, Peter Quince.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUINCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Robin Starveling, you must play Thisby's mother.</div>
                     <div class="line">Tom Snout, the tinker.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SNOUT</div>
                     <div class="line">Here, Peter Quince.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUINCE</div>
                     <div class="line">You, Pyramus' father: myself, Thisby's father:</div>
                     <div class="line">Snug, the joiner; you, the lion's part: and, I</div>
                     <div class="line">hope, here is a play fitted.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SNUG</div>
                     <div class="line">Have you the lion's part written? pray you, if it</div>
                     <div class="line">be, give it me, for I am slow of study.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUINCE</div>
                     <div class="line">You may do it extempore, for it is nothing but roaring.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOTTOM</div>
                     <div class="line">Let me play the lion too: I will roar, that I will</div>
                     <div class="line">do any man's heart good to hear me; I will roar,</div>
                     <div class="line">that I will make the duke say 'Let him roar again,</div>
                     <div class="line">let him roar again.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUINCE</div>
                     <div class="line">An you should do it too terribly, you would fright</div>
                     <div class="line">the duchess and the ladies, that they would shriek;</div>
                     <div class="line">and that were enough to hang us all.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALL</div>
                     <div class="line">That would hang us, every mother's son.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOTTOM</div>
                     <div class="line">I grant you, friends, if that you should fright the</div>
                     <div class="line">ladies out of their wits, they would have no more</div>
                     <div class="line">discretion but to hang us: but I will aggravate my</div>
                     <div class="line">voice so that I will roar you as gently as any</div>
                     <div class="line">sucking dove; I will roar you an 'twere any</div>
                     <div class="line">nightingale.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUINCE</div>
                     <div class="line">You can play no part but Pyramus; for Pyramus is a</div>
                     <div class="line">sweet-faced man; a proper man, as one shall see in a</div>
                     <div class="line">summer's day; a most lovely gentleman-like man:</div>
                     <div class="line">therefore you must needs play Pyramus.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOTTOM</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, I will undertake it. What beard were I best</div>
                     <div class="line">to play it in?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUINCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, what you will.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOTTOM</div>
                     <div class="line">I will discharge it in either your straw-colour</div>
                     <div class="line">beard, your orange-tawny beard, your purple-in-grain</div>
                     <div class="line">beard, or your French-crown-colour beard, your</div>
                     <div class="line">perfect yellow.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUINCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Some of your French crowns have no hair at all, and</div>
                     <div class="line">then you will play bare-faced. But, masters, here</div>
                     <div class="line">are your parts: and I am to entreat you, request</div>
                     <div class="line">you and desire you, to con them by to-morrow night;</div>
                     <div class="line">and meet me in the palace wood, a mile without the</div>
                     <div class="line">town, by moonlight; there will we rehearse, for if</div>
                     <div class="line">we meet in the city, we shall be dogged with</div>
                     <div class="line">company, and our devices known. In the meantime I</div>
                     <div class="line">will draw a bill of properties, such as our play</div>
                     <div class="line">wants. I pray you, fail me not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOTTOM</div>
                     <div class="line">We will meet; and there we may rehearse most</div>
                     <div class="line">obscenely and courageously. Take pains; be perfect: adieu.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUINCE</div>
                     <div class="line">At the duke's oak we meet.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOTTOM</div>
                     <div class="line">Enough; hold or cut bow-strings.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.4">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 2. ACT II</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.4.2">1. SCENE I.  A wood near Athens.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.4.3">2. SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.4.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  A wood near Athens.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter, from opposite sides, a Fairy, and PUCK</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PUCK</div>
                     <div class="line">How now, spirit! whither wander you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Fairy</div>
                     <div class="line">Over hill, over dale,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thorough bush, thorough brier,</div>
                     <div class="line">Over park, over pale,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thorough flood, thorough fire,</div>
                     <div class="line">I do wander everywhere,</div>
                     <div class="line">Swifter than the moon's sphere;</div>
                     <div class="line">And I serve the fairy queen,</div>
                     <div class="line">To dew her orbs upon the green.</div>
                     <div class="line">The cowslips tall her pensioners be:</div>
                     <div class="line">In their gold coats spots you see;</div>
                     <div class="line">Those be rubies, fairy favours,</div>
                     <div class="line">In those freckles live their savours:</div>
                     <div class="line">I must go seek some dewdrops here</div>
                     <div class="line">And hang a pearl in every cowslip's ear.</div>
                     <div class="line">Farewell, thou lob of spirits; I'll be gone:</div>
                     <div class="line">Our queen and all our elves come here anon.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PUCK</div>
                     <div class="line">The king doth keep his revels here to-night:</div>
                     <div class="line">Take heed the queen come not within his sight;</div>
                     <div class="line">For Oberon is passing fell and wrath,</div>
                     <div class="line">Because that she as her attendant hath</div>
                     <div class="line">A lovely boy, stolen from an Indian king;</div>
                     <div class="line">She never had so sweet a changeling;</div>
                     <div class="line">And jealous Oberon would have the child</div>
                     <div class="line">Knight of his train, to trace the forests wild;</div>
                     <div class="line">But she perforce withholds the loved boy,</div>
                     <div class="line">Crowns him with flowers and makes him all her joy:</div>
                     <div class="line">And now they never meet in grove or green,</div>
                     <div class="line">By fountain clear, or spangled starlight sheen,</div>
                     <div class="line">But, they do square, that all their elves for fear</div>
                     <div class="line">Creep into acorn-cups and hide them there.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Fairy</div>
                     <div class="line">Either I mistake your shape and making quite,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or else you are that shrewd and knavish sprite</div>
                     <div class="line">Call'd Robin Goodfellow: are not you he</div>
                     <div class="line">That frights the maidens of the villagery;</div>
                     <div class="line">Skim milk, and sometimes labour in the quern</div>
                     <div class="line">And bootless make the breathless housewife churn;</div>
                     <div class="line">And sometime make the drink to bear no barm;</div>
                     <div class="line">Mislead night-wanderers, laughing at their harm?</div>
                     <div class="line">Those that Hobgoblin call you and sweet Puck,</div>
                     <div class="line">You do their work, and they shall have good luck:</div>
                     <div class="line">Are not you he?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PUCK</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou speak'st aright;</div>
                     <div class="line">I am that merry wanderer of the night.</div>
                     <div class="line">I jest to Oberon and make him smile</div>
                     <div class="line">When I a fat and bean-fed horse beguile,</div>
                     <div class="line">Neighing in likeness of a filly foal:</div>
                     <div class="line">And sometime lurk I in a gossip's bowl,</div>
                     <div class="line">In very likeness of a roasted crab,</div>
                     <div class="line">And when she drinks, against her lips I bob</div>
                     <div class="line">And on her wither'd dewlap pour the ale.</div>
                     <div class="line">The wisest aunt, telling the saddest tale,</div>
                     <div class="line">Sometime for three-foot stool mistaketh me;</div>
                     <div class="line">Then slip I from her bum, down topples she,</div>
                     <div class="line">And 'tailor' cries, and falls into a cough;</div>
                     <div class="line">And then the whole quire hold their hips and laugh,</div>
                     <div class="line">And waxen in their mirth and neeze and swear</div>
                     <div class="line">A merrier hour was never wasted there.</div>
                     <div class="line">But, room, fairy! here comes Oberon.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Fairy</div>
                     <div class="line">And here my mistress. Would that he were gone!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter, from one side, OBERON, with his train;
from the other, TITANIA, with hers</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OBERON</div>
                     <div class="line">Ill met by moonlight, proud Titania.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TITANIA</div>
                     <div class="line">What, jealous Oberon! Fairies, skip hence:</div>
                     <div class="line">I have forsworn his bed and company.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OBERON</div>
                     <div class="line">Tarry, rash wanton: am not I thy lord?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TITANIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Then I must be thy lady: but I know</div>
                     <div class="line">When thou hast stolen away from fairy land,</div>
                     <div class="line">And in the shape of Corin sat all day,</div>
                     <div class="line">Playing on pipes of corn and versing love</div>
                     <div class="line">To amorous Phillida. Why art thou here,</div>
                     <div class="line">Come from the farthest Steppe of India?</div>
                     <div class="line">But that, forsooth, the bouncing Amazon,</div>
                     <div class="line">Your buskin'd mistress and your warrior love,</div>
                     <div class="line">To Theseus must be wedded, and you come</div>
                     <div class="line">To give their bed joy and prosperity.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OBERON</div>
                     <div class="line">How canst thou thus for shame, Titania,</div>
                     <div class="line">Glance at my credit with Hippolyta,</div>
                     <div class="line">Knowing I know thy love to Theseus?</div>
                     <div class="line">Didst thou not lead him through the glimmering night</div>
                     <div class="line">From Perigenia, whom he ravished?</div>
                     <div class="line">And make him with fair AEgle break his faith,</div>
                     <div class="line">With Ariadne and Antiopa?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TITANIA</div>
                     <div class="line">These are the forgeries of jealousy:</div>
                     <div class="line">And never, since the middle summer's spring,</div>
                     <div class="line">Met we on hill, in dale, forest or mead,</div>
                     <div class="line">By paved fountain or by rushy brook,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or in the beached margent of the sea,</div>
                     <div class="line">To dance our ringlets to the whistling wind,</div>
                     <div class="line">But with thy brawls thou hast disturb'd our sport.</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore the winds, piping to us in vain,</div>
                     <div class="line">As in revenge, have suck'd up from the sea</div>
                     <div class="line">Contagious fogs; which falling in the land</div>
                     <div class="line">Have every pelting river made so proud</div>
                     <div class="line">That they have overborne their continents:</div>
                     <div class="line">The ox hath therefore stretch'd his yoke in vain,</div>
                     <div class="line">The ploughman lost his sweat, and the green corn</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath rotted ere his youth attain'd a beard;</div>
                     <div class="line">The fold stands empty in the drowned field,</div>
                     <div class="line">And crows are fatted with the murrion flock;</div>
                     <div class="line">The nine men's morris is fill'd up with mud,</div>
                     <div class="line">And the quaint mazes in the wanton green</div>
                     <div class="line">For lack of tread are undistinguishable:</div>
                     <div class="line">The human mortals want their winter here;</div>
                     <div class="line">No night is now with hymn or carol blest:</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore the moon, the governess of floods,</div>
                     <div class="line">Pale in her anger, washes all the air,</div>
                     <div class="line">That rheumatic diseases do abound:</div>
                     <div class="line">And thorough this distemperature we see</div>
                     <div class="line">The seasons alter: hoary-headed frosts</div>
                     <div class="line">Far in the fresh lap of the crimson rose,</div>
                     <div class="line">And on old Hiems' thin and icy crown</div>
                     <div class="line">An odorous chaplet of sweet summer buds</div>
                     <div class="line">Is, as in mockery, set: the spring, the summer,</div>
                     <div class="line">The childing autumn, angry winter, change</div>
                     <div class="line">Their wonted liveries, and the mazed world,</div>
                     <div class="line">By their increase, now knows not which is which:</div>
                     <div class="line">And this same progeny of evils comes</div>
                     <div class="line">From our debate, from our dissension;</div>
                     <div class="line">We are their parents and original.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OBERON</div>
                     <div class="line">Do you amend it then; it lies in you:</div>
                     <div class="line">Why should Titania cross her Oberon?</div>
                     <div class="line">I do but beg a little changeling boy,</div>
                     <div class="line">To be my henchman.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TITANIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Set your heart at rest:</div>
                     <div class="line">The fairy land buys not the child of me.</div>
                     <div class="line">His mother was a votaress of my order:</div>
                     <div class="line">And, in the spiced Indian air, by night,</div>
                     <div class="line">Full often hath she gossip'd by my side,</div>
                     <div class="line">And sat with me on Neptune's yellow sands,</div>
                     <div class="line">Marking the embarked traders on the flood,</div>
                     <div class="line">When we have laugh'd to see the sails conceive</div>
                     <div class="line">And grow big-bellied with the wanton wind;</div>
                     <div class="line">Which she, with pretty and with swimming gait</div>
                     <div class="line">Following,--her womb then rich with my young squire,--</div>
                     <div class="line">Would imitate, and sail upon the land,</div>
                     <div class="line">To fetch me trifles, and return again,</div>
                     <div class="line">As from a voyage, rich with merchandise.</div>
                     <div class="line">But she, being mortal, of that boy did die;</div>
                     <div class="line">And for her sake do I rear up her boy,</div>
                     <div class="line">And for her sake I will not part with him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OBERON</div>
                     <div class="line">How long within this wood intend you stay?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TITANIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Perchance till after Theseus' wedding-day.</div>
                     <div class="line">If you will patiently dance in our round</div>
                     <div class="line">And see our moonlight revels, go with us;</div>
                     <div class="line">If not, shun me, and I will spare your haunts.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OBERON</div>
                     <div class="line">Give me that boy, and I will go with thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TITANIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Not for thy fairy kingdom. Fairies, away!</div>
                     <div class="line">We shall chide downright, if I longer stay.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit TITANIA with her train</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OBERON</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, go thy way: thou shalt not from this grove</div>
                     <div class="line">Till I torment thee for this injury.</div>
                     <div class="line">My gentle Puck, come hither. Thou rememberest</div>
                     <div class="line">Since once I sat upon a promontory,</div>
                     <div class="line">And heard a mermaid on a dolphin's back</div>
                     <div class="line">Uttering such dulcet and harmonious breath</div>
                     <div class="line">That the rude sea grew civil at her song</div>
                     <div class="line">And certain stars shot madly from their spheres,</div>
                     <div class="line">To hear the sea-maid's music.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PUCK</div>
                     <div class="line">I remember.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OBERON</div>
                     <div class="line">That very time I saw, but thou couldst not,</div>
                     <div class="line">Flying between the cold moon and the earth,</div>
                     <div class="line">Cupid all arm'd: a certain aim he took</div>
                     <div class="line">At a fair vestal throned by the west,</div>
                     <div class="line">And loosed his love-shaft smartly from his bow,</div>
                     <div class="line">As it should pierce a hundred thousand hearts;</div>
                     <div class="line">But I might see young Cupid's fiery shaft</div>
                     <div class="line">Quench'd in the chaste beams of the watery moon,</div>
                     <div class="line">And the imperial votaress passed on,</div>
                     <div class="line">In maiden meditation, fancy-free.</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet mark'd I where the bolt of Cupid fell:</div>
                     <div class="line">It fell upon a little western flower,</div>
                     <div class="line">Before milk-white, now purple with love's wound,</div>
                     <div class="line">And maidens call it love-in-idleness.</div>
                     <div class="line">Fetch me that flower; the herb I shew'd thee once:</div>
                     <div class="line">The juice of it on sleeping eye-lids laid</div>
                     <div class="line">Will make or man or woman madly dote</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon the next live creature that it sees.</div>
                     <div class="line">Fetch me this herb; and be thou here again</div>
                     <div class="line">Ere the leviathan can swim a league.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PUCK</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll put a girdle round about the earth</div>
                     <div class="line">In forty minutes.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OBERON</div>
                     <div class="line">Having once this juice,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll watch Titania when she is asleep,</div>
                     <div class="line">And drop the liquor of it in her eyes.</div>
                     <div class="line">The next thing then she waking looks upon,</div>
                     <div class="line">Be it on lion, bear, or wolf, or bull,</div>
                     <div class="line">On meddling monkey, or on busy ape,</div>
                     <div class="line">She shall pursue it with the soul of love:</div>
                     <div class="line">And ere I take this charm from off her sight,</div>
                     <div class="line">As I can take it with another herb,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll make her render up her page to me.</div>
                     <div class="line">But who comes here? I am invisible;</div>
                     <div class="line">And I will overhear their conference.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter DEMETRIUS, HELENA, following him</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DEMETRIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I love thee not, therefore pursue me not.</div>
                     <div class="line">Where is Lysander and fair Hermia?</div>
                     <div class="line">The one I'll slay, the other slayeth me.</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou told'st me they were stolen unto this wood;</div>
                     <div class="line">And here am I, and wode within this wood,</div>
                     <div class="line">Because I cannot meet my Hermia.</div>
                     <div class="line">Hence, get thee gone, and follow me no more.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">You draw me, you hard-hearted adamant;</div>
                     <div class="line">But yet you draw not iron, for my heart</div>
                     <div class="line">Is true as steel: leave you your power to draw,</div>
                     <div class="line">And I shall have no power to follow you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DEMETRIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Do I entice you? do I speak you fair?</div>
                     <div class="line">Or, rather, do I not in plainest truth</div>
                     <div class="line">Tell you, I do not, nor I cannot love you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">And even for that do I love you the more.</div>
                     <div class="line">I am your spaniel; and, Demetrius,</div>
                     <div class="line">The more you beat me, I will fawn on you:</div>
                     <div class="line">Use me but as your spaniel, spurn me, strike me,</div>
                     <div class="line">Neglect me, lose me; only give me leave,</div>
                     <div class="line">Unworthy as I am, to follow you.</div>
                     <div class="line">What worser place can I beg in your love,--</div>
                     <div class="line">And yet a place of high respect with me,--</div>
                     <div class="line">Than to be used as you use your dog?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DEMETRIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Tempt not too much the hatred of my spirit;</div>
                     <div class="line">For I am sick when I do look on thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">And I am sick when I look not on you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DEMETRIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">You do impeach your modesty too much,</div>
                     <div class="line">To leave the city and commit yourself</div>
                     <div class="line">Into the hands of one that loves you not;</div>
                     <div class="line">To trust the opportunity of night</div>
                     <div class="line">And the ill counsel of a desert place</div>
                     <div class="line">With the rich worth of your virginity.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">Your virtue is my privilege: for that</div>
                     <div class="line">It is not night when I do see your face,</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore I think I am not in the night;</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor doth this wood lack worlds of company,</div>
                     <div class="line">For you in my respect are all the world:</div>
                     <div class="line">Then how can it be said I am alone,</div>
                     <div class="line">When all the world is here to look on me?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DEMETRIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll run from thee and hide me in the brakes,</div>
                     <div class="line">And leave thee to the mercy of wild beasts.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">The wildest hath not such a heart as you.</div>
                     <div class="line">Run when you will, the story shall be changed:</div>
                     <div class="line">Apollo flies, and Daphne holds the chase;</div>
                     <div class="line">The dove pursues the griffin; the mild hind</div>
                     <div class="line">Makes speed to catch the tiger; bootless speed,</div>
                     <div class="line">When cowardice pursues and valour flies.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
