                     <div class="speaker">DEMETRIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I will not stay thy questions; let me go:</div>
                     <div class="line">Or, if thou follow me, do not believe</div>
                     <div class="line">But I shall do thee mischief in the wood.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, in the temple, in the town, the field,</div>
                     <div class="line">You do me mischief. Fie, Demetrius!</div>
                     <div class="line">Your wrongs do set a scandal on my sex:</div>
                     <div class="line">We cannot fight for love, as men may do;</div>
                     <div class="line">We should be wood and were not made to woo.</div>
                     <p>Exit DEMETRIUS</p>
                     <div class="line">I'll follow thee and make a heaven of hell,</div>
                     <div class="line">To die upon the hand I love so well.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OBERON</div>
                     <div class="line">Fare thee well, nymph: ere he do leave this grove,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou shalt fly him and he shall seek thy love.</div>
                     <p>Re-enter PUCK</p>
                     <div class="line">Hast thou the flower there? Welcome, wanderer.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PUCK</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, there it is.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OBERON</div>
                     <div class="line">I pray thee, give it me.</div>
                     <div class="line">I know a bank where the wild thyme blows,</div>
                     <div class="line">Where oxlips and the nodding violet grows,</div>
                     <div class="line">Quite over-canopied with luscious woodbine,</div>
                     <div class="line">With sweet musk-roses and with eglantine:</div>
                     <div class="line">There sleeps Titania sometime of the night,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lull'd in these flowers with dances and delight;</div>
                     <div class="line">And there the snake throws her enamell'd skin,</div>
                     <div class="line">Weed wide enough to wrap a fairy in:</div>
                     <div class="line">And with the juice of this I'll streak her eyes,</div>
                     <div class="line">And make her full of hateful fantasies.</div>
                     <div class="line">Take thou some of it, and seek through this grove:</div>
                     <div class="line">A sweet Athenian lady is in love</div>
                     <div class="line">With a disdainful youth: anoint his eyes;</div>
                     <div class="line">But do it when the next thing he espies</div>
                     <div class="line">May be the lady: thou shalt know the man</div>
                     <div class="line">By the Athenian garments he hath on.</div>
                     <div class="line">Effect it with some care, that he may prove</div>
                     <div class="line">More fond on her than she upon her love:</div>
                     <div class="line">And look thou meet me ere the first cock crow.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PUCK</div>
                     <div class="line">Fear not, my lord, your servant shall do so.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.4.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter TITANIA, with her train</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TITANIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, now a roundel and a fairy song;</div>
                     <div class="line">Then, for the third part of a minute, hence;</div>
                     <div class="line">Some to kill cankers in the musk-rose buds,</div>
                     <div class="line">Some war with rere-mice for their leathern wings,</div>
                     <div class="line">To make my small elves coats, and some keep back</div>
                     <div class="line">The clamorous owl that nightly hoots and wonders</div>
                     <div class="line">At our quaint spirits. Sing me now asleep;</div>
                     <div class="line">Then to your offices and let me rest.</div>
                     <p>The Fairies sing</p>
                     <div class="line">You spotted snakes with double tongue,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thorny hedgehogs, be not seen;</div>
                     <div class="line">Newts and blind-worms, do no wrong,</div>
                     <div class="line">Come not near our fairy queen.</div>
                     <div class="line">Philomel, with melody</div>
                     <div class="line">Sing in our sweet lullaby;</div>
                     <div class="line">Lulla, lulla, lullaby, lulla, lulla, lullaby:</div>
                     <div class="line">Never harm,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor spell nor charm,</div>
                     <div class="line">Come our lovely lady nigh;</div>
                     <div class="line">So, good night, with lullaby.</div>
                     <div class="line">Weaving spiders, come not here;</div>
                     <div class="line">Hence, you long-legg'd spinners, hence!</div>
                     <div class="line">Beetles black, approach not near;</div>
                     <div class="line">Worm nor snail, do no offence.</div>
                     <div class="line">Philomel, with melody, &c.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Fairy</div>
                     <div class="line">Hence, away! now all is well:</div>
                     <div class="line">One aloof stand sentinel.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt Fairies. TITANIA sleeps</p>
               <p>Enter OBERON and squeezes the flower on TITANIA's eyelids</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OBERON</div>
                     <div class="line">What thou seest when thou dost wake,</div>
                     <div class="line">Do it for thy true-love take,</div>
                     <div class="line">Love and languish for his sake:</div>
                     <div class="line">Be it ounce, or cat, or bear,</div>
                     <div class="line">Pard, or boar with bristled hair,</div>
                     <div class="line">In thy eye that shall appear</div>
                     <div class="line">When thou wakest, it is thy dear:</div>
                     <div class="line">Wake when some vile thing is near.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <p>Enter LYSANDER and HERMIA</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LYSANDER</div>
                     <div class="line">Fair love, you faint with wandering in the wood;</div>
                     <div class="line">And to speak troth, I have forgot our way:</div>
                     <div class="line">We'll rest us, Hermia, if you think it good,</div>
                     <div class="line">And tarry for the comfort of the day.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HERMIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Be it so, Lysander: find you out a bed;</div>
                     <div class="line">For I upon this bank will rest my head.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LYSANDER</div>
                     <div class="line">One turf shall serve as pillow for us both;</div>
                     <div class="line">One heart, one bed, two bosoms and one troth.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HERMIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, good Lysander; for my sake, my dear,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lie further off yet, do not lie so near.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LYSANDER</div>
                     <div class="line">O, take the sense, sweet, of my innocence!</div>
                     <div class="line">Love takes the meaning in love's conference.</div>
                     <div class="line">I mean, that my heart unto yours is knit</div>
                     <div class="line">So that but one heart we can make of it;</div>
                     <div class="line">Two bosoms interchained with an oath;</div>
                     <div class="line">So then two bosoms and a single troth.</div>
                     <div class="line">Then by your side no bed-room me deny;</div>
                     <div class="line">For lying so, Hermia, I do not lie.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HERMIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Lysander riddles very prettily:</div>
                     <div class="line">Now much beshrew my manners and my pride,</div>
                     <div class="line">If Hermia meant to say Lysander lied.</div>
                     <div class="line">But, gentle friend, for love and courtesy</div>
                     <div class="line">Lie further off; in human modesty,</div>
                     <div class="line">Such separation as may well be said</div>
                     <div class="line">Becomes a virtuous bachelor and a maid,</div>
                     <div class="line">So far be distant; and, good night, sweet friend:</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy love ne'er alter till thy sweet life end!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LYSANDER</div>
                     <div class="line">Amen, amen, to that fair prayer, say I;</div>
                     <div class="line">And then end life when I end loyalty!</div>
                     <div class="line">Here is my bed: sleep give thee all his rest!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HERMIA</div>
                     <div class="line">With half that wish the wisher's eyes be press'd!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>They sleep</p>
               <p>Enter PUCK</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PUCK</div>
                     <div class="line">Through the forest have I gone.</div>
                     <div class="line">But Athenian found I none,</div>
                     <div class="line">On whose eyes I might approve</div>
                     <div class="line">This flower's force in stirring love.</div>
                     <div class="line">Night and silence.--Who is here?</div>
                     <div class="line">Weeds of Athens he doth wear:</div>
                     <div class="line">This is he, my master said,</div>
                     <div class="line">Despised the Athenian maid;</div>
                     <div class="line">And here the maiden, sleeping sound,</div>
                     <div class="line">On the dank and dirty ground.</div>
                     <div class="line">Pretty soul! she durst not lie</div>
                     <div class="line">Near this lack-love, this kill-courtesy.</div>
                     <div class="line">Churl, upon thy eyes I throw</div>
                     <div class="line">All the power this charm doth owe.</div>
                     <div class="line">When thou wakest, let love forbid</div>
                     <div class="line">Sleep his seat on thy eyelid:</div>
                     <div class="line">So awake when I am gone;</div>
                     <div class="line">For I must now to Oberon.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <p>Enter DEMETRIUS and HELENA, running</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">Stay, though thou kill me, sweet Demetrius.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DEMETRIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I charge thee, hence, and do not haunt me thus.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">O, wilt thou darkling leave me? do not so.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DEMETRIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Stay, on thy peril: I alone will go.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">O, I am out of breath in this fond chase!</div>
                     <div class="line">The more my prayer, the lesser is my grace.</div>
                     <div class="line">Happy is Hermia, wheresoe'er she lies;</div>
                     <div class="line">For she hath blessed and attractive eyes.</div>
                     <div class="line">How came her eyes so bright? Not with salt tears:</div>
                     <div class="line">If so, my eyes are oftener wash'd than hers.</div>
                     <div class="line">No, no, I am as ugly as a bear;</div>
                     <div class="line">For beasts that meet me run away for fear:</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore no marvel though Demetrius</div>
                     <div class="line">Do, as a monster fly my presence thus.</div>
                     <div class="line">What wicked and dissembling glass of mine</div>
                     <div class="line">Made me compare with Hermia's sphery eyne?</div>
                     <div class="line">But who is here? Lysander! on the ground!</div>
                     <div class="line">Dead? or asleep? I see no blood, no wound.</div>
                     <div class="line">Lysander if you live, good sir, awake.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LYSANDER</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Awaking</span>  And run through fire I will for thy sweet sake.</div>
                     <div class="line">Transparent Helena! Nature shows art,</div>
                     <div class="line">That through thy bosom makes me see thy heart.</div>
                     <div class="line">Where is Demetrius? O, how fit a word</div>
                     <div class="line">Is that vile name to perish on my sword!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">Do not say so, Lysander; say not so</div>
                     <div class="line">What though he love your Hermia? Lord, what though?</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet Hermia still loves you: then be content.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LYSANDER</div>
                     <div class="line">Content with Hermia! No; I do repent</div>
                     <div class="line">The tedious minutes I with her have spent.</div>
                     <div class="line">Not Hermia but Helena I love:</div>
                     <div class="line">Who will not change a raven for a dove?</div>
                     <div class="line">The will of man is by his reason sway'd;</div>
                     <div class="line">And reason says you are the worthier maid.</div>
                     <div class="line">Things growing are not ripe until their season</div>
                     <div class="line">So I, being young, till now ripe not to reason;</div>
                     <div class="line">And touching now the point of human skill,</div>
                     <div class="line">Reason becomes the marshal to my will</div>
                     <div class="line">And leads me to your eyes, where I o'erlook</div>
                     <div class="line">Love's stories written in love's richest book.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">Wherefore was I to this keen mockery born?</div>
                     <div class="line">When at your hands did I deserve this scorn?</div>
                     <div class="line">Is't not enough, is't not enough, young man,</div>
                     <div class="line">That I did never, no, nor never can,</div>
                     <div class="line">Deserve a sweet look from Demetrius' eye,</div>
                     <div class="line">But you must flout my insufficiency?</div>
                     <div class="line">Good troth, you do me wrong, good sooth, you do,</div>
                     <div class="line">In such disdainful manner me to woo.</div>
                     <div class="line">But fare you well: perforce I must confess</div>
                     <div class="line">I thought you lord of more true gentleness.</div>
                     <div class="line">O, that a lady, of one man refused.</div>
                     <div class="line">Should of another therefore be abused!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LYSANDER</div>
                     <div class="line">She sees not Hermia. Hermia, sleep thou there:</div>
                     <div class="line">And never mayst thou come Lysander near!</div>
                     <div class="line">For as a surfeit of the sweetest things</div>
                     <div class="line">The deepest loathing to the stomach brings,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or as tie heresies that men do leave</div>
                     <div class="line">Are hated most of those they did deceive,</div>
                     <div class="line">So thou, my surfeit and my heresy,</div>
                     <div class="line">Of all be hated, but the most of me!</div>
                     <div class="line">And, all my powers, address your love and might</div>
                     <div class="line">To honour Helen and to be her knight!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HERMIA</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Awaking</span>  Help me, Lysander, help me! do thy best</div>
                     <div class="line">To pluck this crawling serpent from my breast!</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay me, for pity! what a dream was here!</div>
                     <div class="line">Lysander, look how I do quake with fear:</div>
                     <div class="line">Methought a serpent eat my heart away,</div>
                     <div class="line">And you sat smiling at his cruel pray.</div>
                     <div class="line">Lysander! what, removed? Lysander! lord!</div>
                     <div class="line">What, out of hearing? gone? no sound, no word?</div>
                     <div class="line">Alack, where are you speak, an if you hear;</div>
                     <div class="line">Speak, of all loves! I swoon almost with fear.</div>
                     <div class="line">No? then I well perceive you all not nigh</div>
                     <div class="line">Either death or you I'll find immediately.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.5">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 3. ACT III</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.5.2">1. SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.5.3">2. SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.5.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter QUINCE, SNUG, BOTTOM, FLUTE, SNOUT, and
STARVELING</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOTTOM</div>
                     <div class="line">Are we all met?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUINCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Pat, pat; and here's a marvellous convenient place</div>
                     <div class="line">for our rehearsal. This green plot shall be our</div>
                     <div class="line">stage, this hawthorn-brake our tiring-house; and we</div>
                     <div class="line">will do it in action as we will do it before the duke.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOTTOM</div>
                     <div class="line">Peter Quince,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUINCE</div>
                     <div class="line">What sayest thou, bully Bottom?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOTTOM</div>
                     <div class="line">There are things in this comedy of Pyramus and</div>
                     <div class="line">Thisby that will never please. First, Pyramus must</div>
                     <div class="line">draw a sword to kill himself; which the ladies</div>
                     <div class="line">cannot abide. How answer you that?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SNOUT</div>
                     <div class="line">By'r lakin, a parlous fear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">STARVELING</div>
                     <div class="line">I believe we must leave the killing out, when all is done.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOTTOM</div>
                     <div class="line">Not a whit: I have a device to make all well.</div>
                     <div class="line">Write me a prologue; and let the prologue seem to</div>
                     <div class="line">say, we will do no harm with our swords, and that</div>
                     <div class="line">Pyramus is not killed indeed; and, for the more</div>
                     <div class="line">better assurance, tell them that I, Pyramus, am not</div>
                     <div class="line">Pyramus, but Bottom the weaver: this will put them</div>
                     <div class="line">out of fear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUINCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, we will have such a prologue; and it shall be</div>
                     <div class="line">written in eight and six.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOTTOM</div>
                     <div class="line">No, make it two more; let it be written in eight and eight.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SNOUT</div>
                     <div class="line">Will not the ladies be afeard of the lion?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">STARVELING</div>
                     <div class="line">I fear it, I promise you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOTTOM</div>
                     <div class="line">Masters, you ought to consider with yourselves: to</div>
                     <div class="line">bring in--God shield us!--a lion among ladies, is a</div>
                     <div class="line">most dreadful thing; for there is not a more fearful</div>
                     <div class="line">wild-fowl than your lion living; and we ought to</div>
                     <div class="line">look to 't.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SNOUT</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore another prologue must tell he is not a lion.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOTTOM</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, you must name his name, and half his face must</div>
                     <div class="line">be seen through the lion's neck: and he himself</div>
                     <div class="line">must speak through, saying thus, or to the same</div>
                     <div class="line">defect,--'Ladies,'--or 'Fair-ladies--I would wish</div>
                     <div class="line">You,'--or 'I would request you,'--or 'I would</div>
                     <div class="line">entreat you,--not to fear, not to tremble: my life</div>
                     <div class="line">for yours. If you think I come hither as a lion, it</div>
                     <div class="line">were pity of my life: no I am no such thing; I am a</div>
                     <div class="line">man as other men are;' and there indeed let him name</div>
                     <div class="line">his name, and tell them plainly he is Snug the joiner.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUINCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Well it shall be so. But there is two hard things;</div>
                     <div class="line">that is, to bring the moonlight into a chamber; for,</div>
                     <div class="line">you know, Pyramus and Thisby meet by moonlight.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SNOUT</div>
                     <div class="line">Doth the moon shine that night we play our play?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOTTOM</div>
                     <div class="line">A calendar, a calendar! look in the almanac; find</div>
                     <div class="line">out moonshine, find out moonshine.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUINCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Yes, it doth shine that night.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOTTOM</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, then may you leave a casement of the great</div>
                     <div class="line">chamber window, where we play, open, and the moon</div>
                     <div class="line">may shine in at the casement.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUINCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay; or else one must come in with a bush of thorns</div>
                     <div class="line">and a lanthorn, and say he comes to disfigure, or to</div>
                     <div class="line">present, the person of Moonshine. Then, there is</div>
                     <div class="line">another thing: we must have a wall in the great</div>
                     <div class="line">chamber; for Pyramus and Thisby says the story, did</div>
                     <div class="line">talk through the chink of a wall.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SNOUT</div>
                     <div class="line">You can never bring in a wall. What say you, Bottom?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOTTOM</div>
                     <div class="line">Some man or other must present Wall: and let him</div>
                     <div class="line">have some plaster, or some loam, or some rough-cast</div>
                     <div class="line">about him, to signify wall; and let him hold his</div>
                     <div class="line">fingers thus, and through that cranny shall Pyramus</div>
                     <div class="line">and Thisby whisper.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUINCE</div>
                     <div class="line">If that may be, then all is well. Come, sit down,</div>
                     <div class="line">every mother's son, and rehearse your parts.</div>
                     <div class="line">Pyramus, you begin: when you have spoken your</div>
                     <div class="line">speech, enter into that brake: and so every one</div>
                     <div class="line">according to his cue.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter PUCK behind</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PUCK</div>
                     <div class="line">What hempen home-spuns have we swaggering here,</div>
                     <div class="line">So near the cradle of the fairy queen?</div>
                     <div class="line">What, a play toward! I'll be an auditor;</div>
                     <div class="line">An actor too, perhaps, if I see cause.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUINCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Speak, Pyramus. Thisby, stand forth.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOTTOM</div>
                     <div class="line">Thisby, the flowers of odious savours sweet,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUINCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Odours, odours.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOTTOM</div>
                     <div class="line">--odours savours sweet:</div>
                     <div class="line">So hath thy breath, my dearest Thisby dear.</div>
                     <div class="line">But hark, a voice! stay thou but here awhile,</div>
                     <div class="line">And by and by I will to thee appear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PUCK</div>
                     <div class="line">A stranger Pyramus than e'er played here.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FLUTE</div>
                     <div class="line">Must I speak now?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUINCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, marry, must you; for you must understand he goes</div>
                     <div class="line">but to see a noise that he heard, and is to come again.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FLUTE</div>
                     <div class="line">Most radiant Pyramus, most lily-white of hue,</div>
                     <div class="line">Of colour like the red rose on triumphant brier,</div>
                     <div class="line">Most brisky juvenal and eke most lovely Jew,</div>
                     <div class="line">As true as truest horse that yet would never tire,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll meet thee, Pyramus, at Ninny's tomb.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUINCE</div>
                     <div class="line">'Ninus' tomb,' man: why, you must not speak that</div>
                     <div class="line">yet; that you answer to Pyramus: you speak all your</div>
                     <div class="line">part at once, cues and all Pyramus enter: your cue</div>
                     <div class="line">is past; it is, 'never tire.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FLUTE</div>
                     <div class="line">O,--As true as truest horse, that yet would</div>
                     <div class="line">never tire.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Re-enter PUCK, and BOTTOM with an ass's head</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOTTOM</div>
                     <div class="line">If I were fair, Thisby, I were only thine.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUINCE</div>
                     <div class="line">O monstrous! O strange! we are haunted. Pray,</div>
                     <div class="line">masters! fly, masters! Help!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt QUINCE, SNUG, FLUTE, SNOUT, and STARVELING</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PUCK</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll follow you, I'll lead you about a round,</div>
                     <div class="line">Through bog, through bush, through brake, through brier:</div>
                     <div class="line">Sometime a horse I'll be, sometime a hound,</div>
                     <div class="line">A hog, a headless bear, sometime a fire;</div>
                     <div class="line">And neigh, and bark, and grunt, and roar, and burn,</div>
                     <div class="line">Like horse, hound, hog, bear, fire, at every turn.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOTTOM</div>
                     <div class="line">Why do they run away? this is a knavery of them to</div>
                     <div class="line">make me afeard.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Re-enter SNOUT</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SNOUT</div>
                     <div class="line">O Bottom, thou art changed! what do I see on thee?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOTTOM</div>
                     <div class="line">What do you see? you see an asshead of your own, do</div>
                     <div class="line">you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit SNOUT</p>
               <p>Re-enter QUINCE</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUINCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Bless thee, Bottom! bless thee! thou art</div>
                     <div class="line">translated.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOTTOM</div>
                     <div class="line">I see their knavery: this is to make an ass of me;</div>
                     <div class="line">to fright me, if they could. But I will not stir</div>
                     <div class="line">from this place, do what they can: I will walk up</div>
                     <div class="line">and down here, and I will sing, that they shall hear</div>
                     <div class="line">I am not afraid.</div>
                     <p>Sings</p>
                     <div class="line">The ousel cock so black of hue,</div>
                     <div class="line">With orange-tawny bill,</div>
                     <div class="line">The throstle with his note so true,</div>
                     <div class="line">The wren with little quill,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TITANIA</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Awaking</span>  What angel wakes me from my flowery bed?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOTTOM</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Sings</span>
                     </div>
                     <div class="line">The finch, the sparrow and the lark,</div>
                     <div class="line">The plain-song cuckoo gray,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose note full many a man doth mark,</div>
                     <div class="line">And dares not answer nay;--</div>
                     <div class="line">for, indeed, who would set his wit to so foolish</div>
                     <div class="line">a bird? who would give a bird the lie, though he cry</div>
                     <div class="line">'cuckoo' never so?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TITANIA</div>
                     <div class="line">I pray thee, gentle mortal, sing again:</div>
                     <div class="line">Mine ear is much enamour'd of thy note;</div>
                     <div class="line">So is mine eye enthralled to thy shape;</div>
                     <div class="line">And thy fair virtue's force perforce doth move me</div>
                     <div class="line">On the first view to say, to swear, I love thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOTTOM</div>
                     <div class="line">Methinks, mistress, you should have little reason</div>
                     <div class="line">for that: and yet, to say the truth, reason and</div>
                     <div class="line">love keep little company together now-a-days; the</div>
                     <div class="line">more the pity that some honest neighbours will not</div>
                     <div class="line">make them friends. Nay, I can gleek upon occasion.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TITANIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou art as wise as thou art beautiful.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOTTOM</div>
                     <div class="line">Not so, neither: but if I had wit enough to get out</div>
                     <div class="line">of this wood, I have enough to serve mine own turn.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TITANIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Out of this wood do not desire to go:</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou shalt remain here, whether thou wilt or no.</div>
                     <div class="line">I am a spirit of no common rate;</div>
                     <div class="line">The summer still doth tend upon my state;</div>
                     <div class="line">And I do love thee: therefore, go with me;</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll give thee fairies to attend on thee,</div>
                     <div class="line">And they shall fetch thee jewels from the deep,</div>
                     <div class="line">And sing while thou on pressed flowers dost sleep;</div>
                     <div class="line">And I will purge thy mortal grossness so</div>
                     <div class="line">That thou shalt like an airy spirit go.</div>
                     <div class="line">Peaseblossom! Cobweb! Moth! and Mustardseed!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter PEASEBLOSSOM, COBWEB, MOTH, and MUSTARDSEED</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PEASEBLOSSOM</div>
                     <div class="line">Ready.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COBWEB</div>
                     <div class="line">And I.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">And I.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MUSTARDSEED</div>
                     <div class="line">And I.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALL</div>
                     <div class="line">Where shall we go?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TITANIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Be kind and courteous to this gentleman;</div>
                     <div class="line">Hop in his walks and gambol in his eyes;</div>
                     <div class="line">Feed him with apricocks and dewberries,</div>
                     <div class="line">With purple grapes, green figs, and mulberries;</div>
                     <div class="line">The honey-bags steal from the humble-bees,</div>
                     <div class="line">And for night-tapers crop their waxen thighs</div>
                     <div class="line">And light them at the fiery glow-worm's eyes,</div>
                     <div class="line">To have my love to bed and to arise;</div>
                     <div class="line">And pluck the wings from Painted butterflies</div>
                     <div class="line">To fan the moonbeams from his sleeping eyes:</div>
                     <div class="line">Nod to him, elves, and do him courtesies.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PEASEBLOSSOM</div>
                     <div class="line">Hail, mortal!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COBWEB</div>
                     <div class="line">Hail!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">Hail!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MUSTARDSEED</div>
                     <div class="line">Hail!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOTTOM</div>
                     <div class="line">I cry your worship's mercy, heartily: I beseech your</div>
                     <div class="line">worship's name.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COBWEB</div>
                     <div class="line">Cobweb.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOTTOM</div>
                     <div class="line">I shall desire you of more acquaintance, good Master</div>
                     <div class="line">Cobweb: if I cut my finger, I shall make bold with</div>
                     <div class="line">you. Your name, honest gentleman?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PEASEBLOSSOM</div>
                     <div class="line">Peaseblossom.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOTTOM</div>
                     <div class="line">I pray you, commend me to Mistress Squash, your</div>
                     <div class="line">mother, and to Master Peascod, your father. Good</div>
                     <div class="line">Master Peaseblossom, I shall desire you of more</div>
                     <div class="line">acquaintance too. Your name, I beseech you, sir?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MUSTARDSEED</div>
                     <div class="line">Mustardseed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOTTOM</div>
                     <div class="line">Good Master Mustardseed, I know your patience well:</div>
                     <div class="line">that same cowardly, giant-like ox-beef hath</div>
                     <div class="line">devoured many a gentleman of your house: I promise</div>
                     <div class="line">you your kindred had made my eyes water ere now. I</div>
                     <div class="line">desire your more acquaintance, good Master</div>
                     <div class="line">Mustardseed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TITANIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, wait upon him; lead him to my bower.</div>
                     <div class="line">The moon methinks looks with a watery eye;</div>
                     <div class="line">And when she weeps, weeps every little flower,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lamenting some enforced chastity.</div>
                     <div class="line">Tie up my love's tongue bring him silently.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.5.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter OBERON</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OBERON</div>
                     <div class="line">I wonder if Titania be awaked;</div>
                     <div class="line">Then, what it was that next came in her eye,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which she must dote on in extremity.</div>
                     <p>Enter PUCK</p>
                     <div class="line">Here comes my messenger.</div>
                     <div class="line">How now, mad spirit!</div>
                     <div class="line">What night-rule now about this haunted grove?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PUCK</div>
                     <div class="line">My mistress with a monster is in love.</div>
                     <div class="line">Near to her close and consecrated bower,</div>
                     <div class="line">While she was in her dull and sleeping hour,</div>
                     <div class="line">A crew of patches, rude mechanicals,</div>
                     <div class="line">That work for bread upon Athenian stalls,</div>
                     <div class="line">Were met together to rehearse a play</div>
                     <div class="line">Intended for great Theseus' nuptial-day.</div>
                     <div class="line">The shallowest thick-skin of that barren sort,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who Pyramus presented, in their sport</div>
                     <div class="line">Forsook his scene and enter'd in a brake</div>
                     <div class="line">When I did him at this advantage take,</div>
                     <div class="line">An ass's nole I fixed on his head:</div>
                     <div class="line">Anon his Thisbe must be answered,</div>
                     <div class="line">And forth my mimic comes. When they him spy,</div>
                     <div class="line">As wild geese that the creeping fowler eye,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or russet-pated choughs, many in sort,</div>
                     <div class="line">Rising and cawing at the gun's report,</div>
                     <div class="line">Sever themselves and madly sweep the sky,</div>
                     <div class="line">So, at his sight, away his fellows fly;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, at our stamp, here o'er and o'er one falls;</div>
                     <div class="line">He murder cries and help from Athens calls.</div>
                     <div class="line">Their sense thus weak, lost with their fears</div>
                     <div class="line">thus strong,</div>
                     <div class="line">Made senseless things begin to do them wrong;</div>
                     <div class="line">For briers and thorns at their apparel snatch;</div>
                     <div class="line">Some sleeves, some hats, from yielders all</div>
                     <div class="line">things catch.</div>
                     <div class="line">I led them on in this distracted fear,</div>
                     <div class="line">And left sweet Pyramus translated there:</div>
                     <div class="line">When in that moment, so it came to pass,</div>
                     <div class="line">Titania waked and straightway loved an ass.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OBERON</div>
                     <div class="line">This falls out better than I could devise.</div>
                     <div class="line">But hast thou yet latch'd the Athenian's eyes</div>
                     <div class="line">With the love-juice, as I did bid thee do?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PUCK</div>
                     <div class="line">I took him sleeping,--that is finish'd too,--</div>
                     <div class="line">And the Athenian woman by his side:</div>
                     <div class="line">That, when he waked, of force she must be eyed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter HERMIA and DEMETRIUS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OBERON</div>
                     <div class="line">Stand close: this is the same Athenian.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PUCK</div>
                     <div class="line">This is the woman, but not this the man.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DEMETRIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">O, why rebuke you him that loves you so?</div>
                     <div class="line">Lay breath so bitter on your bitter foe.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HERMIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Now I but chide; but I should use thee worse,</div>
                     <div class="line">For thou, I fear, hast given me cause to curse,</div>
                     <div class="line">If thou hast slain Lysander in his sleep,</div>
                     <div class="line">Being o'er shoes in blood, plunge in the deep,</div>
                     <div class="line">And kill me too.</div>
                     <div class="line">The sun was not so true unto the day</div>
                     <div class="line">As he to me: would he have stolen away</div>
                     <div class="line">From sleeping Hermia? I'll believe as soon</div>
                     <div class="line">This whole earth may be bored and that the moon</div>
                     <div class="line">May through the centre creep and so displease</div>
                     <div class="line">Her brother's noontide with Antipodes.</div>
                     <div class="line">It cannot be but thou hast murder'd him;</div>
                     <div class="line">So should a murderer look, so dead, so grim.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DEMETRIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">So should the murder'd look, and so should I,</div>
                     <div class="line">Pierced through the heart with your stern cruelty:</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet you, the murderer, look as bright, as clear,</div>
                     <div class="line">As yonder Venus in her glimmering sphere.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HERMIA</div>
                     <div class="line">What's this to my Lysander? where is he?</div>
                     <div class="line">Ah, good Demetrius, wilt thou give him me?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DEMETRIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I had rather give his carcass to my hounds.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HERMIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Out, dog! out, cur! thou drivest me past the bounds</div>
                     <div class="line">Of maiden's patience. Hast thou slain him, then?</div>
                     <div class="line">Henceforth be never number'd among men!</div>
                     <div class="line">O, once tell true, tell true, even for my sake!</div>
                     <div class="line">Durst thou have look'd upon him being awake,</div>
                     <div class="line">And hast thou kill'd him sleeping? O brave touch!</div>
                     <div class="line">Could not a worm, an adder, do so much?</div>
                     <div class="line">An adder did it; for with doubler tongue</div>
                     <div class="line">Than thine, thou serpent, never adder stung.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DEMETRIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">You spend your passion on a misprised mood:</div>
                     <div class="line">I am not guilty of Lysander's blood;</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor is he dead, for aught that I can tell.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HERMIA</div>
                     <div class="line">I pray thee, tell me then that he is well.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DEMETRIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">An if I could, what should I get therefore?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HERMIA</div>
                     <div class="line">A privilege never to see me more.</div>
                     <div class="line">And from thy hated presence part I so:</div>
                     <div class="line">See me no more, whether he be dead or no.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DEMETRIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">There is no following her in this fierce vein:</div>
                     <div class="line">Here therefore for a while I will remain.</div>
                     <div class="line">So sorrow's heaviness doth heavier grow</div>
                     <div class="line">For debt that bankrupt sleep doth sorrow owe:</div>
                     <div class="line">Which now in some slight measure it will pay,</div>
                     <div class="line">If for his tender here I make some stay.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Lies down and sleeps</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OBERON</div>
                     <div class="line">What hast thou done? thou hast mistaken quite</div>
                     <div class="line">And laid the love-juice on some true-love's sight:</div>
                     <div class="line">Of thy misprision must perforce ensue</div>
                     <div class="line">Some true love turn'd and not a false turn'd true.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PUCK</div>
                     <div class="line">Then fate o'er-rules, that, one man holding troth,</div>
                     <div class="line">A million fail, confounding oath on oath.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OBERON</div>
                     <div class="line">About the wood go swifter than the wind,</div>
                     <div class="line">And Helena of Athens look thou find:</div>
                     <div class="line">All fancy-sick she is and pale of cheer,</div>
                     <div class="line">With sighs of love, that costs the fresh blood dear:</div>
                     <div class="line">By some illusion see thou bring her here:</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll charm his eyes against she do appear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PUCK</div>
                     <div class="line">I go, I go; look how I go,</div>
                     <div class="line">Swifter than arrow from the Tartar's bow.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OBERON</div>
                     <div class="line">Flower of this purple dye,</div>
                     <div class="line">Hit with Cupid's archery,</div>
                     <div class="line">Sink in apple of his eye.</div>
                     <div class="line">When his love he doth espy,</div>
                     <div class="line">Let her shine as gloriously</div>
                     <div class="line">As the Venus of the sky.</div>
                     <div class="line">When thou wakest, if she be by,</div>
                     <div class="line">Beg of her for remedy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Re-enter PUCK</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PUCK</div>
                     <div class="line">Captain of our fairy band,</div>
                     <div class="line">Helena is here at hand;</div>
                     <div class="line">And the youth, mistook by me,</div>
                     <div class="line">Pleading for a lover's fee.</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall we their fond pageant see?</div>
                     <div class="line">Lord, what fools these mortals be!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OBERON</div>
                     <div class="line">Stand aside: the noise they make</div>
                     <div class="line">Will cause Demetrius to awake.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PUCK</div>
                     <div class="line">Then will two at once woo one;</div>
                     <div class="line">That must needs be sport alone;</div>
                     <div class="line">And those things do best please me</div>
                     <div class="line">That befal preposterously.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter LYSANDER and HELENA</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LYSANDER</div>
                     <div class="line">Why should you think that I should woo in scorn?</div>
                     <div class="line">Scorn and derision never come in tears:</div>
                     <div class="line">Look, when I vow, I weep; and vows so born,</div>
                     <div class="line">In their nativity all truth appears.</div>
                     <div class="line">How can these things in me seem scorn to you,</div>
                     <div class="line">Bearing the badge of faith, to prove them true?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">You do advance your cunning more and more.</div>
                     <div class="line">When truth kills truth, O devilish-holy fray!</div>
                     <div class="line">These vows are Hermia's: will you give her o'er?</div>
                     <div class="line">Weigh oath with oath, and you will nothing weigh:</div>
                     <div class="line">Your vows to her and me, put in two scales,</div>
                     <div class="line">Will even weigh, and both as light as tales.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LYSANDER</div>
                     <div class="line">I had no judgment when to her I swore.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor none, in my mind, now you give her o'er.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LYSANDER</div>
                     <div class="line">Demetrius loves her, and he loves not you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DEMETRIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Awaking</span>  O Helena, goddess, nymph, perfect, divine!</div>
                     <div class="line">To what, my love, shall I compare thine eyne?</div>
                     <div class="line">Crystal is muddy. O, how ripe in show</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy lips, those kissing cherries, tempting grow!</div>
                     <div class="line">That pure congealed white, high Taurus snow,</div>
                     <div class="line">Fann'd with the eastern wind, turns to a crow</div>
                     <div class="line">When thou hold'st up thy hand: O, let me kiss</div>
                     <div class="line">This princess of pure white, this seal of bliss!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">O spite! O hell! I see you all are bent</div>
                     <div class="line">To set against me for your merriment:</div>
                     <div class="line">If you we re civil and knew courtesy,</div>
                     <div class="line">You would not do me thus much injury.</div>
                     <div class="line">Can you not hate me, as I know you do,</div>
                     <div class="line">But you must join in souls to mock me too?</div>
                     <div class="line">If you were men, as men you are in show,</div>
                     <div class="line">You would not use a gentle lady so;</div>
                     <div class="line">To vow, and swear, and superpraise my parts,</div>
                     <div class="line">When I am sure you hate me with your hearts.</div>
                     <div class="line">You both are rivals, and love Hermia;</div>
                     <div class="line">And now both rivals, to mock Helena:</div>
                     <div class="line">A trim exploit, a manly enterprise,</div>
                     <div class="line">To conjure tears up in a poor maid's eyes</div>
                     <div class="line">With your derision! none of noble sort</div>
                     <div class="line">Would so offend a virgin, and extort</div>
                     <div class="line">A poor soul's patience, all to make you sport.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LYSANDER</div>
                     <div class="line">You are unkind, Demetrius; be not so;</div>
                     <div class="line">For you love Hermia; this you know I know:</div>
                     <div class="line">And here, with all good will, with all my heart,</div>
                     <div class="line">In Hermia's love I yield you up my part;</div>
                     <div class="line">And yours of Helena to me bequeath,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whom I do love and will do till my death.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">Never did mockers waste more idle breath.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DEMETRIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Lysander, keep thy Hermia; I will none:</div>
                     <div class="line">If e'er I loved her, all that love is gone.</div>
                     <div class="line">My heart to her but as guest-wise sojourn'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">And now to Helen is it home return'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">There to remain.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LYSANDER</div>
                     <div class="line">Helen, it is not so.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DEMETRIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Disparage not the faith thou dost not know,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lest, to thy peril, thou aby it dear.</div>
                     <div class="line">Look, where thy love comes; yonder is thy dear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Re-enter HERMIA</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HERMIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Dark night, that from the eye his function takes,</div>
                     <div class="line">The ear more quick of apprehension makes;</div>
                     <div class="line">Wherein it doth impair the seeing sense,</div>
                     <div class="line">It pays the hearing double recompense.</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou art not by mine eye, Lysander, found;</div>
                     <div class="line">Mine ear, I thank it, brought me to thy sound</div>
                     <div class="line">But why unkindly didst thou leave me so?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LYSANDER</div>
                     <div class="line">Why should he stay, whom love doth press to go?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HERMIA</div>
                     <div class="line">What love could press Lysander from my side?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LYSANDER</div>
                     <div class="line">Lysander's love, that would not let him bide,</div>
                     <div class="line">Fair Helena, who more engilds the night</div>
                     <div class="line">Than all you fiery oes and eyes of light.</div>
                     <div class="line">Why seek'st thou me? could not this make thee know,</div>
                     <div class="line">The hate I bear thee made me leave thee so?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HERMIA</div>
                     <div class="line">You speak not as you think: it cannot be.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">Lo, she is one of this confederacy!</div>
                     <div class="line">Now I perceive they have conjoin'd all three</div>
                     <div class="line">To fashion this false sport, in spite of me.</div>
                     <div class="line">Injurious Hermia! most ungrateful maid!</div>
                     <div class="line">Have you conspired, have you with these contrived</div>
                     <div class="line">To bait me with this foul derision?</div>
                     <div class="line">Is all the counsel that we two have shared,</div>
                     <div class="line">The sisters' vows, the hours that we have spent,</div>
                     <div class="line">When we have chid the hasty-footed time</div>
                     <div class="line">For parting us,--O, is it all forgot?</div>
                     <div class="line">All school-days' friendship, childhood innocence?</div>
                     <div class="line">We, Hermia, like two artificial gods,</div>
                     <div class="line">Have with our needles created both one flower,</div>
                     <div class="line">Both on one sampler, sitting on one cushion,</div>
                     <div class="line">Both warbling of one song, both in one key,</div>
                     <div class="line">As if our hands, our sides, voices and minds,</div>
                     <div class="line">Had been incorporate. So we grow together,</div>
                     <div class="line">Like to a double cherry, seeming parted,</div>
                     <div class="line">But yet an union in partition;</div>
