                     <div class="line">When I from Thebes came last a conqueror.</div>
                     <p>Reads</p>
                     <div class="line">'The thrice three Muses mourning for the death</div>
                     <div class="line">Of Learning, late deceased in beggary.'</div>
                     <div class="line">That is some satire, keen and critical,</div>
                     <div class="line">Not sorting with a nuptial ceremony.</div>
                     <p>Reads</p>
                     <div class="line">'A tedious brief scene of young Pyramus</div>
                     <div class="line">And his love Thisbe; very tragical mirth.'</div>
                     <div class="line">Merry and tragical! tedious and brief!</div>
                     <div class="line">That is, hot ice and wondrous strange snow.</div>
                     <div class="line">How shall we find the concord of this discord?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PHILOSTRATE</div>
                     <div class="line">A play there is, my lord, some ten words long,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which is as brief as I have known a play;</div>
                     <div class="line">But by ten words, my lord, it is too long,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which makes it tedious; for in all the play</div>
                     <div class="line">There is not one word apt, one player fitted:</div>
                     <div class="line">And tragical, my noble lord, it is;</div>
                     <div class="line">For Pyramus therein doth kill himself.</div>
                     <div class="line">Which, when I saw rehearsed, I must confess,</div>
                     <div class="line">Made mine eyes water; but more merry tears</div>
                     <div class="line">The passion of loud laughter never shed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THESEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">What are they that do play it?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PHILOSTRATE</div>
                     <div class="line">Hard-handed men that work in Athens here,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which never labour'd in their minds till now,</div>
                     <div class="line">And now have toil'd their unbreathed memories</div>
                     <div class="line">With this same play, against your nuptial.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THESEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">And we will hear it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PHILOSTRATE</div>
                     <div class="line">No, my noble lord;</div>
                     <div class="line">It is not for you: I have heard it over,</div>
                     <div class="line">And it is nothing, nothing in the world;</div>
                     <div class="line">Unless you can find sport in their intents,</div>
                     <div class="line">Extremely stretch'd and conn'd with cruel pain,</div>
                     <div class="line">To do you service.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THESEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I will hear that play;</div>
                     <div class="line">For never anything can be amiss,</div>
                     <div class="line">When simpleness and duty tender it.</div>
                     <div class="line">Go, bring them in: and take your places, ladies.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit PHILOSTRATE</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HIPPOLYTA</div>
                     <div class="line">I love not to see wretchedness o'er charged</div>
                     <div class="line">And duty in his service perishing.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THESEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, gentle sweet, you shall see no such thing.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HIPPOLYTA</div>
                     <div class="line">He says they can do nothing in this kind.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THESEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">The kinder we, to give them thanks for nothing.</div>
                     <div class="line">Our sport shall be to take what they mistake:</div>
                     <div class="line">And what poor duty cannot do, noble respect</div>
                     <div class="line">Takes it in might, not merit.</div>
                     <div class="line">Where I have come, great clerks have purposed</div>
                     <div class="line">To greet me with premeditated welcomes;</div>
                     <div class="line">Where I have seen them shiver and look pale,</div>
                     <div class="line">Make periods in the midst of sentences,</div>
                     <div class="line">Throttle their practised accent in their fears</div>
                     <div class="line">And in conclusion dumbly have broke off,</div>
                     <div class="line">Not paying me a welcome. Trust me, sweet,</div>
                     <div class="line">Out of this silence yet I pick'd a welcome;</div>
                     <div class="line">And in the modesty of fearful duty</div>
                     <div class="line">I read as much as from the rattling tongue</div>
                     <div class="line">Of saucy and audacious eloquence.</div>
                     <div class="line">Love, therefore, and tongue-tied simplicity</div>
                     <div class="line">In least speak most, to my capacity.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Re-enter PHILOSTRATE</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PHILOSTRATE</div>
                     <div class="line">So please your grace, the Prologue is address'd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THESEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Let him approach.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Flourish of trumpets</p>
               <p>Enter QUINCE for the Prologue</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Prologue</div>
                     <div class="line">If we offend, it is with our good will.</div>
                     <div class="line">That you should think, we come not to offend,</div>
                     <div class="line">But with good will. To show our simple skill,</div>
                     <div class="line">That is the true beginning of our end.</div>
                     <div class="line">Consider then we come but in despite.</div>
                     <div class="line">We do not come as minding to contest you,</div>
                     <div class="line">Our true intent is. All for your delight</div>
                     <div class="line">We are not here. That you should here repent you,</div>
                     <div class="line">The actors are at hand and by their show</div>
                     <div class="line">You shall know all that you are like to know.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THESEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">This fellow doth not stand upon points.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LYSANDER</div>
                     <div class="line">He hath rid his prologue like a rough colt; he knows</div>
                     <div class="line">not the stop. A good moral, my lord: it is not</div>
                     <div class="line">enough to speak, but to speak true.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HIPPOLYTA</div>
                     <div class="line">Indeed he hath played on his prologue like a child</div>
                     <div class="line">on a recorder; a sound, but not in government.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THESEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">His speech, was like a tangled chain; nothing</div>
                     <div class="line">impaired, but all disordered. Who is next?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter Pyramus and Thisbe, Wall, Moonshine, and Lion</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Prologue</div>
                     <div class="line">Gentles, perchance you wonder at this show;</div>
                     <div class="line">But wonder on, till truth make all things plain.</div>
                     <div class="line">This man is Pyramus, if you would know;</div>
                     <div class="line">This beauteous lady Thisby is certain.</div>
                     <div class="line">This man, with lime and rough-cast, doth present</div>
                     <div class="line">Wall, that vile Wall which did these lovers sunder;</div>
                     <div class="line">And through Wall's chink, poor souls, they are content</div>
                     <div class="line">To whisper. At the which let no man wonder.</div>
                     <div class="line">This man, with lanthorn, dog, and bush of thorn,</div>
                     <div class="line">Presenteth Moonshine; for, if you will know,</div>
                     <div class="line">By moonshine did these lovers think no scorn</div>
                     <div class="line">To meet at Ninus' tomb, there, there to woo.</div>
                     <div class="line">This grisly beast, which Lion hight by name,</div>
                     <div class="line">The trusty Thisby, coming first by night,</div>
                     <div class="line">Did scare away, or rather did affright;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, as she fled, her mantle she did fall,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which Lion vile with bloody mouth did stain.</div>
                     <div class="line">Anon comes Pyramus, sweet youth and tall,</div>
                     <div class="line">And finds his trusty Thisby's mantle slain:</div>
                     <div class="line">Whereat, with blade, with bloody blameful blade,</div>
                     <div class="line">He bravely broach'd is boiling bloody breast;</div>
                     <div class="line">And Thisby, tarrying in mulberry shade,</div>
                     <div class="line">His dagger drew, and died. For all the rest,</div>
                     <div class="line">Let Lion, Moonshine, Wall, and lovers twain</div>
                     <div class="line">At large discourse, while here they do remain.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt Prologue, Thisbe, Lion, and Moonshine</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THESEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I wonder if the lion be to speak.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DEMETRIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">No wonder, my lord: one lion may, when many asses do.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Wall</div>
                     <div class="line">In this same interlude it doth befall</div>
                     <div class="line">That I, one Snout by name, present a wall;</div>
                     <div class="line">And such a wall, as I would have you think,</div>
                     <div class="line">That had in it a crannied hole or chink,</div>
                     <div class="line">Through which the lovers, Pyramus and Thisby,</div>
                     <div class="line">Did whisper often very secretly.</div>
                     <div class="line">This loam, this rough-cast and this stone doth show</div>
                     <div class="line">That I am that same wall; the truth is so:</div>
                     <div class="line">And this the cranny is, right and sinister,</div>
                     <div class="line">Through which the fearful lovers are to whisper.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THESEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Would you desire lime and hair to speak better?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DEMETRIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">It is the wittiest partition that ever I heard</div>
                     <div class="line">discourse, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter Pyramus</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THESEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Pyramus draws near the wall: silence!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Pyramus</div>
                     <div class="line">O grim-look'd night! O night with hue so black!</div>
                     <div class="line">O night, which ever art when day is not!</div>
                     <div class="line">O night, O night! alack, alack, alack,</div>
                     <div class="line">I fear my Thisby's promise is forgot!</div>
                     <div class="line">And thou, O wall, O sweet, O lovely wall,</div>
                     <div class="line">That stand'st between her father's ground and mine!</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou wall, O wall, O sweet and lovely wall,</div>
                     <div class="line">Show me thy chink, to blink through with mine eyne!</div>
                     <p>Wall holds up his fingers</p>
                     <div class="line">Thanks, courteous wall: Jove shield thee well for this!</div>
                     <div class="line">But what see I? No Thisby do I see.</div>
                     <div class="line">O wicked wall, through whom I see no bliss!</div>
                     <div class="line">Cursed be thy stones for thus deceiving me!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THESEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">The wall, methinks, being sensible, should curse again.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Pyramus</div>
                     <div class="line">No, in truth, sir, he should not. 'Deceiving me'</div>
                     <div class="line">is Thisby's cue: she is to enter now, and I am to</div>
                     <div class="line">spy her through the wall. You shall see, it will</div>
                     <div class="line">fall pat as I told you. Yonder she comes.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter Thisbe</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Thisbe</div>
                     <div class="line">O wall, full often hast thou heard my moans,</div>
                     <div class="line">For parting my fair Pyramus and me!</div>
                     <div class="line">My cherry lips have often kiss'd thy stones,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy stones with lime and hair knit up in thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Pyramus</div>
                     <div class="line">I see a voice: now will I to the chink,</div>
                     <div class="line">To spy an I can hear my Thisby's face. Thisby!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Thisbe</div>
                     <div class="line">My love thou art, my love I think.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Pyramus</div>
                     <div class="line">Think what thou wilt, I am thy lover's grace;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, like Limander, am I trusty still.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Thisbe</div>
                     <div class="line">And I like Helen, till the Fates me kill.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Pyramus</div>
                     <div class="line">Not Shafalus to Procrus was so true.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Thisbe</div>
                     <div class="line">As Shafalus to Procrus, I to you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Pyramus</div>
                     <div class="line">O kiss me through the hole of this vile wall!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Thisbe</div>
                     <div class="line">I kiss the wall's hole, not your lips at all.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Pyramus</div>
                     <div class="line">Wilt thou at Ninny's tomb meet me straightway?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Thisbe</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tide life, 'tide death, I come without delay.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt Pyramus and Thisbe</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Wall</div>
                     <div class="line">Thus have I, Wall, my part discharged so;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, being done, thus Wall away doth go.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THESEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Now is the mural down between the two neighbours.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DEMETRIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">No remedy, my lord, when walls are so wilful to hear</div>
                     <div class="line">without warning.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HIPPOLYTA</div>
                     <div class="line">This is the silliest stuff that ever I heard.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THESEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">The best in this kind are but shadows; and the worst</div>
                     <div class="line">are no worse, if imagination amend them.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HIPPOLYTA</div>
                     <div class="line">It must be your imagination then, and not theirs.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THESEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">If we imagine no worse of them than they of</div>
                     <div class="line">themselves, they may pass for excellent men. Here</div>
                     <div class="line">come two noble beasts in, a man and a lion.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter Lion and Moonshine</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Lion</div>
                     <div class="line">You, ladies, you, whose gentle hearts do fear</div>
                     <div class="line">The smallest monstrous mouse that creeps on floor,</div>
                     <div class="line">May now perchance both quake and tremble here,</div>
                     <div class="line">When lion rough in wildest rage doth roar.</div>
                     <div class="line">Then know that I, one Snug the joiner, am</div>
                     <div class="line">A lion-fell, nor else no lion's dam;</div>
                     <div class="line">For, if I should as lion come in strife</div>
                     <div class="line">Into this place, 'twere pity on my life.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THESEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">A very gentle beast, of a good conscience.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DEMETRIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">The very best at a beast, my lord, that e'er I saw.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LYSANDER</div>
                     <div class="line">This lion is a very fox for his valour.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THESEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">True; and a goose for his discretion.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DEMETRIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Not so, my lord; for his valour cannot carry his</div>
                     <div class="line">discretion; and the fox carries the goose.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THESEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">His discretion, I am sure, cannot carry his valour;</div>
                     <div class="line">for the goose carries not the fox. It is well:</div>
                     <div class="line">leave it to his discretion, and let us listen to the moon.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Moonshine</div>
                     <div class="line">This lanthorn doth the horned moon present;--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DEMETRIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">He should have worn the horns on his head.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THESEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">He is no crescent, and his horns are</div>
                     <div class="line">invisible within the circumference.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Moonshine</div>
                     <div class="line">This lanthorn doth the horned moon present;</div>
                     <div class="line">Myself the man i' the moon do seem to be.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THESEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">This is the greatest error of all the rest: the man</div>
                     <div class="line">should be put into the lanthorn. How is it else the</div>
                     <div class="line">man i' the moon?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DEMETRIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">He dares not come there for the candle; for, you</div>
                     <div class="line">see, it is already in snuff.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HIPPOLYTA</div>
                     <div class="line">I am aweary of this moon: would he would change!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THESEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">It appears, by his small light of discretion, that</div>
                     <div class="line">he is in the wane; but yet, in courtesy, in all</div>
                     <div class="line">reason, we must stay the time.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LYSANDER</div>
                     <div class="line">Proceed, Moon.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Moonshine</div>
                     <div class="line">All that I have to say, is, to tell you that the</div>
                     <div class="line">lanthorn is the moon; I, the man in the moon; this</div>
                     <div class="line">thorn-bush, my thorn-bush; and this dog, my dog.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DEMETRIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, all these should be in the lanthorn; for all</div>
                     <div class="line">these are in the moon. But, silence! here comes Thisbe.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter Thisbe</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Thisbe</div>
                     <div class="line">This is old Ninny's tomb. Where is my love?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Lion</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Roaring</span>  Oh--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Thisbe runs off</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DEMETRIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Well roared, Lion.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THESEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Well run, Thisbe.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HIPPOLYTA</div>
                     <div class="line">Well shone, Moon. Truly, the moon shines with a</div>
                     <div class="line">good grace.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>The Lion shakes Thisbe's mantle, and exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THESEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Well moused, Lion.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LYSANDER</div>
                     <div class="line">And so the lion vanished.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DEMETRIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">And then came Pyramus.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter Pyramus</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Pyramus</div>
                     <div class="line">Sweet Moon, I thank thee for thy sunny beams;</div>
                     <div class="line">I thank thee, Moon, for shining now so bright;</div>
                     <div class="line">For, by thy gracious, golden, glittering gleams,</div>
                     <div class="line">I trust to take of truest Thisby sight.</div>
                     <div class="line">But stay, O spite!</div>
                     <div class="line">But mark, poor knight,</div>
                     <div class="line">What dreadful dole is here!</div>
                     <div class="line">Eyes, do you see?</div>
                     <div class="line">How can it be?</div>
                     <div class="line">O dainty duck! O dear!</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy mantle good,</div>
                     <div class="line">What, stain'd with blood!</div>
                     <div class="line">Approach, ye Furies fell!</div>
                     <div class="line">O Fates, come, come,</div>
                     <div class="line">Cut thread and thrum;</div>
                     <div class="line">Quail, crush, conclude, and quell!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THESEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">This passion, and the death of a dear friend, would</div>
                     <div class="line">go near to make a man look sad.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HIPPOLYTA</div>
                     <div class="line">Beshrew my heart, but I pity the man.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Pyramus</div>
                     <div class="line">O wherefore, Nature, didst thou lions frame?</div>
                     <div class="line">Since lion vile hath here deflower'd my dear:</div>
                     <div class="line">Which is--no, no--which was the fairest dame</div>
                     <div class="line">That lived, that loved, that liked, that look'd</div>
                     <div class="line">with cheer.</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, tears, confound;</div>
                     <div class="line">Out, sword, and wound</div>
                     <div class="line">The pap of Pyramus;</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, that left pap,</div>
                     <div class="line">Where heart doth hop:</div>
                     <p>Stabs himself</p>
                     <div class="line">Thus die I, thus, thus, thus.</div>
                     <div class="line">Now am I dead,</div>
                     <div class="line">Now am I fled;</div>
                     <div class="line">My soul is in the sky:</div>
                     <div class="line">Tongue, lose thy light;</div>
                     <div class="line">Moon take thy flight:</div>
                     <p>Exit Moonshine</p>
                     <div class="line">Now die, die, die, die, die.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Dies</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DEMETRIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">No die, but an ace, for him; for he is but one.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LYSANDER</div>
                     <div class="line">Less than an ace, man; for he is dead; he is nothing.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THESEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">With the help of a surgeon he might yet recover, and</div>
                     <div class="line">prove an ass.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HIPPOLYTA</div>
                     <div class="line">How chance Moonshine is gone before Thisbe comes</div>
                     <div class="line">back and finds her lover?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THESEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">She will find him by starlight. Here she comes; and</div>
                     <div class="line">her passion ends the play.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Re-enter Thisbe</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HIPPOLYTA</div>
                     <div class="line">Methinks she should not use a long one for such a</div>
                     <div class="line">Pyramus: I hope she will be brief.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DEMETRIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">A mote will turn the balance, which Pyramus, which</div>
                     <div class="line">Thisbe, is the better; he for a man, God warrant us;</div>
                     <div class="line">she for a woman, God bless us.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LYSANDER</div>
                     <div class="line">She hath spied him already with those sweet eyes.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DEMETRIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">And thus she means, videlicet:--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Thisbe</div>
                     <div class="line">Asleep, my love?</div>
                     <div class="line">What, dead, my dove?</div>
                     <div class="line">O Pyramus, arise!</div>
                     <div class="line">Speak, speak. Quite dumb?</div>
                     <div class="line">Dead, dead? A tomb</div>
                     <div class="line">Must cover thy sweet eyes.</div>
                     <div class="line">These My lips,</div>
                     <div class="line">This cherry nose,</div>
                     <div class="line">These yellow cowslip cheeks,</div>
                     <div class="line">Are gone, are gone:</div>
                     <div class="line">Lovers, make moan:</div>
                     <div class="line">His eyes were green as leeks.</div>
                     <div class="line">O Sisters Three,</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, come to me,</div>
                     <div class="line">With hands as pale as milk;</div>
                     <div class="line">Lay them in gore,</div>
                     <div class="line">Since you have shore</div>
                     <div class="line">With shears his thread of silk.</div>
                     <div class="line">Tongue, not a word:</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, trusty sword;</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, blade, my breast imbrue:</div>
                     <p>Stabs herself</p>
                     <div class="line">And, farewell, friends;</div>
                     <div class="line">Thus Thisby ends:</div>
                     <div class="line">Adieu, adieu, adieu.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Dies</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THESEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Moonshine and Lion are left to bury the dead.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DEMETRIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, and Wall too.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOTTOM</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Starting up</span>  No assure you; the wall is down that</div>
                     <div class="line">parted their fathers. Will it please you to see the</div>
                     <div class="line">epilogue, or to hear a Bergomask dance between two</div>
                     <div class="line">of our company?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THESEUS</div>
                     <div class="line">No epilogue, I pray you; for your play needs no</div>
                     <div class="line">excuse. Never excuse; for when the players are all</div>
                     <div class="line">dead, there needs none to be blamed. Marry, if he</div>
                     <div class="line">that writ it had played Pyramus and hanged himself</div>
                     <div class="line">in Thisbe's garter, it would have been a fine</div>
                     <div class="line">tragedy: and so it is, truly; and very notably</div>
                     <div class="line">discharged. But come, your Bergomask: let your</div>
                     <div class="line">epilogue alone.</div>
                     <p>A dance</p>
                     <div class="line">The iron tongue of midnight hath told twelve:</div>
                     <div class="line">Lovers, to bed; 'tis almost fairy time.</div>
                     <div class="line">I fear we shall out-sleep the coming morn</div>
                     <div class="line">As much as we this night have overwatch'd.</div>
                     <div class="line">This palpable-gross play hath well beguiled</div>
                     <div class="line">The heavy gait of night. Sweet friends, to bed.</div>
                     <div class="line">A fortnight hold we this solemnity,</div>
                     <div class="line">In nightly revels and new jollity.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
               <p>Enter PUCK</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PUCK</div>
                     <div class="line">Now the hungry lion roars,</div>
                     <div class="line">And the wolf behowls the moon;</div>
                     <div class="line">Whilst the heavy ploughman snores,</div>
                     <div class="line">All with weary task fordone.</div>
                     <div class="line">Now the wasted brands do glow,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whilst the screech-owl, screeching loud,</div>
                     <div class="line">Puts the wretch that lies in woe</div>
                     <div class="line">In remembrance of a shroud.</div>
                     <div class="line">Now it is the time of night</div>
                     <div class="line">That the graves all gaping wide,</div>
                     <div class="line">Every one lets forth his sprite,</div>
                     <div class="line">In the church-way paths to glide:</div>
                     <div class="line">And we fairies, that do run</div>
                     <div class="line">By the triple Hecate's team,</div>
                     <div class="line">From the presence of the sun,</div>
                     <div class="line">Following darkness like a dream,</div>
                     <div class="line">Now are frolic: not a mouse</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall disturb this hallow'd house:</div>
                     <div class="line">I am sent with broom before,</div>
                     <div class="line">To sweep the dust behind the door.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter OBERON and TITANIA with their train</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OBERON</div>
                     <div class="line">Through the house give gathering light,</div>
                     <div class="line">By the dead and drowsy fire:</div>
                     <div class="line">Every elf and fairy sprite</div>
                     <div class="line">Hop as light as bird from brier;</div>
                     <div class="line">And this ditty, after me,</div>
                     <div class="line">Sing, and dance it trippingly.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TITANIA</div>
                     <div class="line">First, rehearse your song by rote</div>
                     <div class="line">To each word a warbling note:</div>
                     <div class="line">Hand in hand, with fairy grace,</div>
                     <div class="line">Will we sing, and bless this place.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Song and dance</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">OBERON</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, until the break of day,</div>
                     <div class="line">Through this house each fairy stray.</div>
                     <div class="line">To the best bride-bed will we,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which by us shall blessed be;</div>
                     <div class="line">And the issue there create</div>
                     <div class="line">Ever shall be fortunate.</div>
                     <div class="line">So shall all the couples three</div>
                     <div class="line">Ever true in loving be;</div>
                     <div class="line">And the blots of Nature's hand</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall not in their issue stand;</div>
                     <div class="line">Never mole, hare lip, nor scar,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor mark prodigious, such as are</div>
                     <div class="line">Despised in nativity,</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall upon their children be.</div>
                     <div class="line">With this field-dew consecrate,</div>
                     <div class="line">Every fairy take his gait;</div>
                     <div class="line">And each several chamber bless,</div>
                     <div class="line">Through this palace, with sweet peace;</div>
                     <div class="line">And the owner of it blest</div>
                     <div class="line">Ever shall in safety rest.</div>
                     <div class="line">Trip away; make no stay;</div>
                     <div class="line">Meet me all by break of day.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt OBERON, TITANIA, and train</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PUCK</div>
                     <div class="line">If we shadows have offended,</div>
                     <div class="line">Think but this, and all is mended,</div>
                     <div class="line">That you have but slumber'd here</div>
                     <div class="line">While these visions did appear.</div>
                     <div class="line">And this weak and idle theme,</div>
                     <div class="line">No more yielding but a dream,</div>
                     <div class="line">Gentles, do not reprehend:</div>
                     <div class="line">if you pardon, we will mend:</div>
                     <div class="line">And, as I am an honest Puck,</div>
                     <div class="line">If we have unearned luck</div>
                     <div class="line">Now to 'scape the serpent's tongue,</div>
                     <div class="line">We will make amends ere long;</div>
                     <div class="line">Else the Puck a liar call;</div>
                     <div class="line">So, good night unto you all.</div>
                     <div class="line">Give me your hands, if we be friends,</div>
                     <div class="line">And Robin shall restore amends.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
            </section>
         </article>
      </article>
      <script src="../../resources/js/prism.js"/>
   </body>
</html>

      <link href="../../resources/css/publishers.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css"/>

      <meta content="DocBook XSL 2.0 Stylesheets Vxxx" name="generator"/>
      <script src="../../resources/js/dbmodnizr.js" type="text/javascript"/>
      <title>A Midsummer Night's Dream</title>
   </head>
   <body>
      <article class="book" id="R.1">
         <header class="book-titlepage">
            <h1>A Midsummer Night's Dream</h1>
         </header>
         <div class="lists-of-titles">
            <div class="toc">

                  </li>
                  <li>

                     </span>
                     <ul class="toc">

                        </li>

                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </li>
                  <li>
                     <span>
                        <a href="#R.1.4">2. ACT II</a>
                     </span>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.2">1. SCENE I.  A wood near Athens.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.3">2. SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </li>
                  <li>
                     <span>
                        <a href="#R.1.5">3. ACT III</a>
                     </span>
                     <ul class="toc">

                              <a href="#R.1.5.2">1. SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.5.3">2. SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </li>
                  <li>
                     <span>
                        <a href="#R.1.6">4. ACT IV</a>
                     </span>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.6.2">1. SCENE I.  The same. LYSANDER, DEMETRIUS, HELENA, and HERMIA lying asleep.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.6.3">2. SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </li>
                  <li>
                     <span>
                        <a href="#R.1.7">5. ACT V</a>
                     </span>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.2">1. SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </li>
               </ul>
            </div>
         </div>
         <div class="content">
            <article class="preface" id="R.1.2">
               <header class="preface-titlepage">
                  <h2>Dramatis Personae</h2>
               </header>
               <div class="content">
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">THESEUS, Duke of Athens.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">EGEUS, father to Hermia.</span>
                  </p>
                  <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
                     <tr>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">
                              <span class="personname">LYSANDER</span>
                              <span class="personname">DEMETRIUS</span>
                           </span>
                        </td>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">in love with Hermia.</span>
                        </td>
                     </tr>
                  </table>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">PHILOSTRATE, master of the revels to Theseus.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">QUINCE, a carpenter.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">SNUG, a joiner.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">BOTTOM, a weaver.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">FLUTE, a bellows-mender.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">SNOUT, a tinker.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">STARVELING, a tailor.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">HIPPOLYTA, queen of the Amazons, betrothed to Theseus.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">HERMIA, daughter to Egeus, in love with Lysander.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">HELENA, in love with Demetrius.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">OBERON, king of the fairies.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">TITANIA, queen of the fairies.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">PUCK, or Robin Goodfellow.</span>
                  </p>
                  <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
                     <tr>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">
                              <span class="personname">PEASEBLOSSOM</span>
                              <span class="personname">COBWEB</span>
                              <span class="personname">MOTH</span>
                              <span class="personname">MUSTARDSEED</span>
                           </span>
                        </td>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">fairies.</span>
                        </td>
                     </tr>
                  </table>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Other fairies attending their King and Queen.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Attendants on Theseus and Hippolyta.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>SCENE  Athens, and a wood near it.</p>
               </div>
            </article>
            <article class="chapter" id="R.1.3">
               <header class="chapter-titlepage">
                  <h2>Chapter 1. ACT I</h2>
               </header>
               <div class="lists-of-titles">
                  <div class="toc">
                     <p>
                        <b>Table of Contents</b>
                     </p>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.2">1. SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.3">2. SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="content">
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.3.2">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>1. SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter THESEUS, HIPPOLYTA, PHILOSTRATE, and
Attendants</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">THESEUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, fair Hippolyta, our nuptial hour</div>
                              <div class="line">Draws on apace; four happy days bring in</div>
                              <div class="line">Another moon: but, O, methinks, how slow</div>
                              <div class="line">This old moon wanes! she lingers my desires,</div>
                              <div class="line">Like to a step-dame or a dowager</div>
                              <div class="line">Long withering out a young man revenue.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HIPPOLYTA</div>
                              <div class="line">Four days will quickly steep themselves in night;</div>
                              <div class="line">Four nights will quickly dream away the time;</div>
                              <div class="line">And then the moon, like to a silver bow</div>
                              <div class="line">New-bent in heaven, shall behold the night</div>
                              <div class="line">Of our solemnities.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">THESEUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Go, Philostrate,</div>
                              <div class="line">Stir up the Athenian youth to merriments;</div>
                              <div class="line">Awake the pert and nimble spirit of mirth;</div>
                              <div class="line">Turn melancholy forth to funerals;</div>
                              <div class="line">The pale companion is not for our pomp.</div>
                              <p>Exit PHILOSTRATE</p>
                              <div class="line">Hippolyta, I woo'd thee with my sword,</div>
                              <div class="line">And won thy love, doing thee injuries;</div>
                              <div class="line">But I will wed thee in another key,</div>
                              <div class="line">With pomp, with triumph and with revelling.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter EGEUS, HERMIA, LYSANDER, and DEMETRIUS</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EGEUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Happy be Theseus, our renowned duke!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">THESEUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Thanks, good Egeus: what's the news with thee?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EGEUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Full of vexation come I, with complaint</div>
                              <div class="line">Against my child, my daughter Hermia.</div>
                              <div class="line">Stand forth, Demetrius. My noble lord,</div>
                              <div class="line">This man hath my consent to marry her.</div>
                              <div class="line">Stand forth, Lysander: and my gracious duke,</div>
                              <div class="line">This man hath bewitch'd the bosom of my child;</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou, thou, Lysander, thou hast given her rhymes,</div>
                              <div class="line">And interchanged love-tokens with my child:</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou hast by moonlight at her window sung,</div>
                              <div class="line">With feigning voice verses of feigning love,</div>
                              <div class="line">And stolen the impression of her fantasy</div>
                              <div class="line">With bracelets of thy hair, rings, gawds, conceits,</div>
                              <div class="line">Knacks, trifles, nosegays, sweetmeats, messengers</div>
                              <div class="line">Of strong prevailment in unharden'd youth:</div>
                              <div class="line">With cunning hast thou filch'd my daughter's heart,</div>
                              <div class="line">Turn'd her obedience, which is due to me,</div>
                              <div class="line">To stubborn harshness: and, my gracious duke,</div>
                              <div class="line">Be it so she; will not here before your grace</div>
                              <div class="line">Consent to marry with Demetrius,</div>
                              <div class="line">I beg the ancient privilege of Athens,</div>
                              <div class="line">As she is mine, I may dispose of her:</div>
                              <div class="line">Which shall be either to this gentleman</div>
                              <div class="line">Or to her death, according to our law</div>
                              <div class="line">Immediately provided in that case.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">THESEUS</div>
                              <div class="line">What say you, Hermia? be advised fair maid:</div>
                              <div class="line">To you your father should be as a god;</div>
                              <div class="line">One that composed your beauties, yea, and one</div>
                              <div class="line">To whom you are but as a form in wax</div>
                              <div class="line">By him imprinted and within his power</div>
                              <div class="line">To leave the figure or disfigure it.</div>
                              <div class="line">Demetrius is a worthy gentleman.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HERMIA</div>
                              <div class="line">So is Lysander.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">THESEUS</div>
                              <div class="line">In himself he is;</div>
                              <div class="line">But in this kind, wanting your father's voice,</div>
                              <div class="line">The other must be held the worthier.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HERMIA</div>
                              <div class="line">I would my father look'd but with my eyes.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">THESEUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Rather your eyes must with his judgment look.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HERMIA</div>
                              <div class="line">I do entreat your grace to pardon me.</div>
                              <div class="line">I know not by what power I am made bold,</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor how it may concern my modesty,</div>
                              <div class="line">In such a presence here to plead my thoughts;</div>
                              <div class="line">But I beseech your grace that I may know</div>
                              <div class="line">The worst that may befall me in this case,</div>
                              <div class="line">If I refuse to wed Demetrius.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">THESEUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Either to die the death or to abjure</div>
                              <div class="line">For ever the society of men.</div>
                              <div class="line">Therefore, fair Hermia, question your desires;</div>
                              <div class="line">Know of your youth, examine well your blood,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whether, if you yield not to your father's choice,</div>
                              <div class="line">You can endure the livery of a nun,</div>
                              <div class="line">For aye to be in shady cloister mew'd,</div>
                              <div class="line">To live a barren sister all your life,</div>
                              <div class="line">Chanting faint hymns to the cold fruitless moon.</div>
                              <div class="line">Thrice-blessed they that master so their blood,</div>
                              <div class="line">To undergo such maiden pilgrimage;</div>
                              <div class="line">But earthlier happy is the rose distill'd,</div>
                              <div class="line">Than that which withering on the virgin thorn</div>
                              <div class="line">Grows, lives and dies in single blessedness.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HERMIA</div>
                              <div class="line">So will I grow, so live, so die, my lord,</div>
                              <div class="line">Ere I will my virgin patent up</div>
                              <div class="line">Unto his lordship, whose unwished yoke</div>
                              <div class="line">My soul consents not to give sovereignty.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">THESEUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Take time to pause; and, by the nest new moon--</div>
                              <div class="line">The sealing-day betwixt my love and me,</div>
                              <div class="line">For everlasting bond of fellowship--</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon that day either prepare to die</div>
                              <div class="line">For disobedience to your father's will,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or else to wed Demetrius, as he would;</div>
                              <div class="line">Or on Diana's altar to protest</div>
                              <div class="line">For aye austerity and single life.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DEMETRIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Relent, sweet Hermia: and, Lysander, yield</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy crazed title to my certain right.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LYSANDER</div>
                              <div class="line">You have her father's love, Demetrius;</div>
                              <div class="line">Let me have Hermia's: do you marry him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EGEUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Scornful Lysander! true, he hath my love,</div>
                              <div class="line">And what is mine my love shall render him.</div>
                              <div class="line">And she is mine, and all my right of her</div>
                              <div class="line">I do estate unto Demetrius.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LYSANDER</div>
                              <div class="line">I am, my lord, as well derived as he,</div>
                              <div class="line">As well possess'd; my love is more than his;</div>
                              <div class="line">My fortunes every way as fairly rank'd,</div>
                              <div class="line">If not with vantage, as Demetrius';</div>
                              <div class="line">And, which is more than all these boasts can be,</div>
                              <div class="line">I am beloved of beauteous Hermia:</div>
                              <div class="line">Why should not I then prosecute my right?</div>
                              <div class="line">Demetrius, I'll avouch it to his head,</div>
                              <div class="line">Made love to Nedar's daughter, Helena,</div>
                              <div class="line">And won her soul; and she, sweet lady, dotes,</div>
                              <div class="line">Devoutly dotes, dotes in idolatry,</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon this spotted and inconstant man.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">THESEUS</div>
                              <div class="line">I must confess that I have heard so much,</div>
                              <div class="line">And with Demetrius thought to have spoke thereof;</div>
                              <div class="line">But, being over-full of self-affairs,</div>
                              <div class="line">My mind did lose it. But, Demetrius, come;</div>
                              <div class="line">And come, Egeus; you shall go with me,</div>
                              <div class="line">I have some private schooling for you both.</div>
                              <div class="line">For you, fair Hermia, look you arm yourself</div>
                              <div class="line">To fit your fancies to your father's will;</div>
                              <div class="line">Or else the law of Athens yields you up--</div>
                              <div class="line">Which by no means we may extenuate--</div>
                              <div class="line">To death, or to a vow of single life.</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, my Hippolyta: what cheer, my love?</div>
                              <div class="line">Demetrius and Egeus, go along:</div>
                              <div class="line">I must employ you in some business</div>
                              <div class="line">Against our nuptial and confer with you</div>
                              <div class="line">Of something nearly that concerns yourselves.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EGEUS</div>
                              <div class="line">With duty and desire we follow you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt all but LYSANDER and HERMIA</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LYSANDER</div>
                              <div class="line">How now, my love! why is your cheek so pale?</div>
                              <div class="line">How chance the roses there do fade so fast?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HERMIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Belike for want of rain, which I could well</div>
                              <div class="line">Beteem them from the tempest of my eyes.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LYSANDER</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay me! for aught that I could ever read,</div>
                              <div class="line">Could ever hear by tale or history,</div>
                              <div class="line">The course of true love never did run smooth;</div>
                              <div class="line">But, either it was different in blood,--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HERMIA</div>
                              <div class="line">O cross! too high to be enthrall'd to low.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LYSANDER</div>
                              <div class="line">Or else misgraffed in respect of years,--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HERMIA</div>
                              <div class="line">O spite! too old to be engaged to young.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LYSANDER</div>
                              <div class="line">Or else it stood upon the choice of friends,--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HERMIA</div>
                              <div class="line">O hell! to choose love by another's eyes.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LYSANDER</div>
                              <div class="line">Or, if there were a sympathy in choice,</div>
                              <div class="line">War, death, or sickness did lay siege to it,</div>
                              <div class="line">Making it momentany as a sound,</div>
                              <div class="line">Swift as a shadow, short as any dream;</div>
                              <div class="line">Brief as the lightning in the collied night,</div>
                              <div class="line">That, in a spleen, unfolds both heaven and earth,</div>
                              <div class="line">And ere a man hath power to say 'Behold!'</div>
                              <div class="line">The jaws of darkness do devour it up:</div>
                              <div class="line">So quick bright things come to confusion.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HERMIA</div>
                              <div class="line">If then true lovers have been ever cross'd,</div>
                              <div class="line">It stands as an edict in destiny:</div>
                              <div class="line">Then let us teach our trial patience,</div>
                              <div class="line">Because it is a customary cross,</div>
                              <div class="line">As due to love as thoughts and dreams and sighs,</div>
