                              <div class="line">But miserable most, to love unloved?</div>
                              <div class="line">This you should pity rather than despise.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HERNIA</div>
                              <div class="line">I understand not what you mean by this.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, do, persever, counterfeit sad looks,</div>
                              <div class="line">Make mouths upon me when I turn my back;</div>
                              <div class="line">Wink each at other; hold the sweet jest up:</div>
                              <div class="line">This sport, well carried, shall be chronicled.</div>
                              <div class="line">If you have any pity, grace, or manners,</div>
                              <div class="line">You would not make me such an argument.</div>
                              <div class="line">But fare ye well: 'tis partly my own fault;</div>
                              <div class="line">Which death or absence soon shall remedy.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LYSANDER</div>
                              <div class="line">Stay, gentle Helena; hear my excuse:</div>
                              <div class="line">My love, my life my soul, fair Helena!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                              <div class="line">O excellent!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HERMIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Sweet, do not scorn her so.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DEMETRIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">If she cannot entreat, I can compel.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LYSANDER</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou canst compel no more than she entreat:</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy threats have no more strength than her weak prayers.</div>
                              <div class="line">Helen, I love thee; by my life, I do:</div>
                              <div class="line">I swear by that which I will lose for thee,</div>
                              <div class="line">To prove him false that says I love thee not.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DEMETRIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">I say I love thee more than he can do.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LYSANDER</div>
                              <div class="line">If thou say so, withdraw, and prove it too.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DEMETRIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Quick, come!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HERMIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Lysander, whereto tends all this?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LYSANDER</div>
                              <div class="line">Away, you Ethiope!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DEMETRIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">No, no; he'll</div>
                              <div class="line">Seem to break loose; take on as you would follow,</div>
                              <div class="line">But yet come not: you are a tame man, go!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LYSANDER</div>
                              <div class="line">Hang off, thou cat, thou burr! vile thing, let loose,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or I will shake thee from me like a serpent!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HERMIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Why are you grown so rude? what change is this?</div>
                              <div class="line">Sweet love,--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LYSANDER</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy love! out, tawny Tartar, out!</div>
                              <div class="line">Out, loathed medicine! hated potion, hence!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HERMIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Do you not jest?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                              <div class="line">Yes, sooth; and so do you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LYSANDER</div>
                              <div class="line">Demetrius, I will keep my word with thee.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DEMETRIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">I would I had your bond, for I perceive</div>
                              <div class="line">A weak bond holds you: I'll not trust your word.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LYSANDER</div>
                              <div class="line">What, should I hurt her, strike her, kill her dead?</div>
                              <div class="line">Although I hate her, I'll not harm her so.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HERMIA</div>
                              <div class="line">What, can you do me greater harm than hate?</div>
                              <div class="line">Hate me! wherefore? O me! what news, my love!</div>
                              <div class="line">Am not I Hermia? are not you Lysander?</div>
                              <div class="line">I am as fair now as I was erewhile.</div>
                              <div class="line">Since night you loved me; yet since night you left</div>
                              <div class="line">me:</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, then you left me--O, the gods forbid!--</div>
                              <div class="line">In earnest, shall I say?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LYSANDER</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, by my life;</div>
                              <div class="line">And never did desire to see thee more.</div>
                              <div class="line">Therefore be out of hope, of question, of doubt;</div>
                              <div class="line">Be certain, nothing truer; 'tis no jest</div>
                              <div class="line">That I do hate thee and love Helena.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HERMIA</div>
                              <div class="line">O me! you juggler! you canker-blossom!</div>
                              <div class="line">You thief of love! what, have you come by night</div>
                              <div class="line">And stolen my love's heart from him?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                              <div class="line">Fine, i'faith!</div>
                              <div class="line">Have you no modesty, no maiden shame,</div>
                              <div class="line">No touch of bashfulness? What, will you tear</div>
                              <div class="line">Impatient answers from my gentle tongue?</div>
                              <div class="line">Fie, fie! you counterfeit, you puppet, you!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HERMIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Puppet? why so? ay, that way goes the game.</div>
                              <div class="line">Now I perceive that she hath made compare</div>
                              <div class="line">Between our statures; she hath urged her height;</div>
                              <div class="line">And with her personage, her tall personage,</div>
                              <div class="line">Her height, forsooth, she hath prevail'd with him.</div>
                              <div class="line">And are you grown so high in his esteem;</div>
                              <div class="line">Because I am so dwarfish and so low?</div>
                              <div class="line">How low am I, thou painted maypole? speak;</div>
                              <div class="line">How low am I? I am not yet so low</div>
                              <div class="line">But that my nails can reach unto thine eyes.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                              <div class="line">I pray you, though you mock me, gentlemen,</div>
                              <div class="line">Let her not hurt me: I was never curst;</div>
                              <div class="line">I have no gift at all in shrewishness;</div>
                              <div class="line">I am a right maid for my cowardice:</div>
                              <div class="line">Let her not strike me. You perhaps may think,</div>
                              <div class="line">Because she is something lower than myself,</div>
                              <div class="line">That I can match her.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HERMIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Lower! hark, again.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                              <div class="line">Good Hermia, do not be so bitter with me.</div>
                              <div class="line">I evermore did love you, Hermia,</div>
                              <div class="line">Did ever keep your counsels, never wrong'd you;</div>
                              <div class="line">Save that, in love unto Demetrius,</div>
                              <div class="line">I told him of your stealth unto this wood.</div>
                              <div class="line">He follow'd you; for love I follow'd him;</div>
                              <div class="line">But he hath chid me hence and threaten'd me</div>
                              <div class="line">To strike me, spurn me, nay, to kill me too:</div>
                              <div class="line">And now, so you will let me quiet go,</div>
                              <div class="line">To Athens will I bear my folly back</div>
                              <div class="line">And follow you no further: let me go:</div>
                              <div class="line">You see how simple and how fond I am.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HERMIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, get you gone: who is't that hinders you?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                              <div class="line">A foolish heart, that I leave here behind.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HERMIA</div>
                              <div class="line">What, with Lysander?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                              <div class="line">With Demetrius.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LYSANDER</div>
                              <div class="line">Be not afraid; she shall not harm thee, Helena.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DEMETRIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">No, sir, she shall not, though you take her part.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                              <div class="line">O, when she's angry, she is keen and shrewd!</div>
                              <div class="line">She was a vixen when she went to school;</div>
                              <div class="line">And though she be but little, she is fierce.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HERMIA</div>
                              <div class="line">'Little' again! nothing but 'low' and 'little'!</div>
                              <div class="line">Why will you suffer her to flout me thus?</div>
                              <div class="line">Let me come to her.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LYSANDER</div>
                              <div class="line">Get you gone, you dwarf;</div>
                              <div class="line">You minimus, of hindering knot-grass made;</div>
                              <div class="line">You bead, you acorn.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DEMETRIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">You are too officious</div>
                              <div class="line">In her behalf that scorns your services.</div>
                              <div class="line">Let her alone: speak not of Helena;</div>
                              <div class="line">Take not her part; for, if thou dost intend</div>
                              <div class="line">Never so little show of love to her,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou shalt aby it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LYSANDER</div>
                              <div class="line">Now she holds me not;</div>
                              <div class="line">Now follow, if thou darest, to try whose right,</div>
                              <div class="line">Of thine or mine, is most in Helena.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DEMETRIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Follow! nay, I'll go with thee, cheek by jole.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt LYSANDER and DEMETRIUS</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HERMIA</div>
                              <div class="line">You, mistress, all this coil is 'long of you:</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, go not back.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                              <div class="line">I will not trust you, I,</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor longer stay in your curst company.</div>
                              <div class="line">Your hands than mine are quicker for a fray,</div>
                              <div class="line">My legs are longer though, to run away.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HERMIA</div>
                              <div class="line">I am amazed, and know not what to say.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">OBERON</div>
                              <div class="line">This is thy negligence: still thou mistakest,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or else committ'st thy knaveries wilfully.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PUCK</div>
                              <div class="line">Believe me, king of shadows, I mistook.</div>
                              <div class="line">Did not you tell me I should know the man</div>
                              <div class="line">By the Athenian garment be had on?</div>
                              <div class="line">And so far blameless proves my enterprise,</div>
                              <div class="line">That I have 'nointed an Athenian's eyes;</div>
                              <div class="line">And so far am I glad it so did sort</div>
                              <div class="line">As this their jangling I esteem a sport.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">OBERON</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou see'st these lovers seek a place to fight:</div>
                              <div class="line">Hie therefore, Robin, overcast the night;</div>
                              <div class="line">The starry welkin cover thou anon</div>
                              <div class="line">With drooping fog as black as Acheron,</div>
                              <div class="line">And lead these testy rivals so astray</div>
                              <div class="line">As one come not within another's way.</div>
                              <div class="line">Like to Lysander sometime frame thy tongue,</div>
                              <div class="line">Then stir Demetrius up with bitter wrong;</div>
                              <div class="line">And sometime rail thou like Demetrius;</div>
                              <div class="line">And from each other look thou lead them thus,</div>
                              <div class="line">Till o'er their brows death-counterfeiting sleep</div>
                              <div class="line">With leaden legs and batty wings doth creep:</div>
                              <div class="line">Then crush this herb into Lysander's eye;</div>
                              <div class="line">Whose liquor hath this virtuous property,</div>
                              <div class="line">To take from thence all error with his might,</div>
                              <div class="line">And make his eyeballs roll with wonted sight.</div>
                              <div class="line">When they next wake, all this derision</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall seem a dream and fruitless vision,</div>
                              <div class="line">And back to Athens shall the lovers wend,</div>
                              <div class="line">With league whose date till death shall never end.</div>
                              <div class="line">Whiles I in this affair do thee employ,</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll to my queen and beg her Indian boy;</div>
                              <div class="line">And then I will her charmed eye release</div>
                              <div class="line">From monster's view, and all things shall be peace.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PUCK</div>
                              <div class="line">My fairy lord, this must be done with haste,</div>
                              <div class="line">For night's swift dragons cut the clouds full fast,</div>
                              <div class="line">And yonder shines Aurora's harbinger;</div>
                              <div class="line">At whose approach, ghosts, wandering here and there,</div>
                              <div class="line">Troop home to churchyards: damned spirits all,</div>
                              <div class="line">That in crossways and floods have burial,</div>
                              <div class="line">Already to their wormy beds are gone;</div>
                              <div class="line">For fear lest day should look their shames upon,</div>
                              <div class="line">They willfully themselves exile from light</div>
                              <div class="line">And must for aye consort with black-brow'd night.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">OBERON</div>
                              <div class="line">But we are spirits of another sort:</div>
                              <div class="line">I with the morning's love have oft made sport,</div>
                              <div class="line">And, like a forester, the groves may tread,</div>
                              <div class="line">Even till the eastern gate, all fiery-red,</div>
                              <div class="line">Opening on Neptune with fair blessed beams,</div>
                              <div class="line">Turns into yellow gold his salt green streams.</div>
                              <div class="line">But, notwithstanding, haste; make no delay:</div>
                              <div class="line">We may effect this business yet ere day.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PUCK</div>
                              <div class="line">Up and down, up and down,</div>
                              <div class="line">I will lead them up and down:</div>
                              <div class="line">I am fear'd in field and town:</div>
                              <div class="line">Goblin, lead them up and down.</div>
                              <div class="line">Here comes one.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Re-enter LYSANDER</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LYSANDER</div>
                              <div class="line">Where art thou, proud Demetrius? speak thou now.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PUCK</div>
                              <div class="line">Here, villain; drawn and ready. Where art thou?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LYSANDER</div>
                              <div class="line">I will be with thee straight.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PUCK</div>
                              <div class="line">Follow me, then,</div>
                              <div class="line">To plainer ground.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit LYSANDER, as following the voice</p>
                        <p>Re-enter DEMETRIUS</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DEMETRIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Lysander! speak again:</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou runaway, thou coward, art thou fled?</div>
                              <div class="line">Speak! In some bush? Where dost thou hide thy head?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PUCK</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou coward, art thou bragging to the stars,</div>
                              <div class="line">Telling the bushes that thou look'st for wars,</div>
                              <div class="line">And wilt not come? Come, recreant; come, thou child;</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll whip thee with a rod: he is defiled</div>
                              <div class="line">That draws a sword on thee.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DEMETRIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Yea, art thou there?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PUCK</div>
                              <div class="line">Follow my voice: we'll try no manhood here.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                        <p>Re-enter LYSANDER</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LYSANDER</div>
                              <div class="line">He goes before me and still dares me on:</div>
                              <div class="line">When I come where he calls, then he is gone.</div>
                              <div class="line">The villain is much lighter-heel'd than I:</div>
                              <div class="line">I follow'd fast, but faster he did fly;</div>
                              <div class="line">That fallen am I in dark uneven way,</div>
                              <div class="line">And here will rest me.</div>
                              <p>Lies down</p>
                              <div class="line">Come, thou gentle day!</div>
                              <div class="line">For if but once thou show me thy grey light,</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll find Demetrius and revenge this spite.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Sleeps</p>
                        <p>Re-enter PUCK and DEMETRIUS</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PUCK</div>
                              <div class="line">Ho, ho, ho! Coward, why comest thou not?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DEMETRIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Abide me, if thou darest; for well I wot</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou runn'st before me, shifting every place,</div>
                              <div class="line">And darest not stand, nor look me in the face.</div>
                              <div class="line">Where art thou now?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PUCK</div>
                              <div class="line">Come hither: I am here.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DEMETRIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, then, thou mock'st me. Thou shalt buy this dear,</div>
                              <div class="line">If ever I thy face by daylight see:</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, go thy way. Faintness constraineth me</div>
                              <div class="line">To measure out my length on this cold bed.</div>
                              <div class="line">By day's approach look to be visited.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Lies down and sleeps</p>
                        <p>Re-enter HELENA</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                              <div class="line">O weary night, O long and tedious night,</div>
                              <div class="line">Abate thy hour! Shine comforts from the east,</div>
                              <div class="line">That I may back to Athens by daylight,</div>
                              <div class="line">From these that my poor company detest:</div>
                              <div class="line">And sleep, that sometimes shuts up sorrow's eye,</div>
                              <div class="line">Steal me awhile from mine own company.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Lies down and sleeps</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PUCK</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet but three? Come one more;</div>
                              <div class="line">Two of both kinds make up four.</div>
                              <div class="line">Here she comes, curst and sad:</div>
                              <div class="line">Cupid is a knavish lad,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thus to make poor females mad.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Re-enter HERMIA</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HERMIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Never so weary, never so in woe,</div>
                              <div class="line">Bedabbled with the dew and torn with briers,</div>
                              <div class="line">I can no further crawl, no further go;</div>
                              <div class="line">My legs can keep no pace with my desires.</div>
                              <div class="line">Here will I rest me till the break of day.</div>
                              <div class="line">Heavens shield Lysander, if they mean a fray!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Lies down and sleeps</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PUCK</div>
                              <div class="line">On the ground</div>
                              <div class="line">Sleep sound:</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll apply</div>
                              <div class="line">To your eye,</div>
                              <div class="line">Gentle lover, remedy.</div>
                              <p>Squeezing the juice on LYSANDER's eyes</p>
                              <div class="line">When thou wakest,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou takest</div>
                              <div class="line">True delight</div>
                              <div class="line">In the sight</div>
                              <div class="line">Of thy former lady's eye:</div>
                              <div class="line">And the country proverb known,</div>
                              <div class="line">That every man should take his own,</div>
                              <div class="line">In your waking shall be shown:</div>
                              <div class="line">Jack shall have Jill;</div>
                              <div class="line">Nought shall go ill;</div>
                              <div class="line">The man shall have his mare again, and all shall be well.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
               </div>
            </article>
            <article class="chapter" id="R.1.6">
               <header class="chapter-titlepage">
                  <h2>Chapter 4. ACT IV</h2>
               </header>
               <div class="lists-of-titles">
                  <div class="toc">
                     <p>
                        <b>Table of Contents</b>
                     </p>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.6.2">1. SCENE I.  The same. LYSANDER, DEMETRIUS, HELENA, and HERMIA lying asleep.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.6.3">2. SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="content">
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.6.2">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>1. SCENE I.  The same. LYSANDER, DEMETRIUS, HELENA, and HERMIA lying asleep.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter TITANIA and BOTTOM; PEASEBLOSSOM, COBWEB, MOTH,
MUSTARDSEED, and other Fairies attending; OBERON
behind unseen</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TITANIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, sit thee down upon this flowery bed,</div>
                              <div class="line">While I thy amiable cheeks do coy,</div>
                              <div class="line">And stick musk-roses in thy sleek smooth head,</div>
                              <div class="line">And kiss thy fair large ears, my gentle joy.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BOTTOM</div>
                              <div class="line">Where's Peaseblossom?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PEASEBLOSSOM</div>
                              <div class="line">Ready.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BOTTOM</div>
                              <div class="line">Scratch my head Peaseblossom. Where's Mounsieur Cobweb?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">COBWEB</div>
                              <div class="line">Ready.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BOTTOM</div>
                              <div class="line">Mounsieur Cobweb, good mounsieur, get you your</div>
                              <div class="line">weapons in your hand, and kill me a red-hipped</div>
                              <div class="line">humble-bee on the top of a thistle; and, good</div>
                              <div class="line">mounsieur, bring me the honey-bag. Do not fret</div>
                              <div class="line">yourself too much in the action, mounsieur; and,</div>
                              <div class="line">good mounsieur, have a care the honey-bag break not;</div>
                              <div class="line">I would be loath to have you overflown with a</div>
                              <div class="line">honey-bag, signior. Where's Mounsieur Mustardseed?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MUSTARDSEED</div>
                              <div class="line">Ready.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BOTTOM</div>
                              <div class="line">Give me your neaf, Mounsieur Mustardseed. Pray you,</div>
                              <div class="line">leave your courtesy, good mounsieur.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MUSTARDSEED</div>
                              <div class="line">What's your Will?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BOTTOM</div>
                              <div class="line">Nothing, good mounsieur, but to help Cavalery Cobweb</div>
                              <div class="line">to scratch. I must to the barber's, monsieur; for</div>
                              <div class="line">methinks I am marvellous hairy about the face; and I</div>
                              <div class="line">am such a tender ass, if my hair do but tickle me,</div>
                              <div class="line">I must scratch.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TITANIA</div>
                              <div class="line">What, wilt thou hear some music,</div>
                              <div class="line">my sweet love?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BOTTOM</div>
                              <div class="line">I have a reasonable good ear in music. Let's have</div>
                              <div class="line">the tongs and the bones.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TITANIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Or say, sweet love, what thou desirest to eat.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BOTTOM</div>
                              <div class="line">Truly, a peck of provender: I could munch your good</div>
                              <div class="line">dry oats. Methinks I have a great desire to a bottle</div>
                              <div class="line">of hay: good hay, sweet hay, hath no fellow.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TITANIA</div>
                              <div class="line">I have a venturous fairy that shall seek</div>
                              <div class="line">The squirrel's hoard, and fetch thee new nuts.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BOTTOM</div>
                              <div class="line">I had rather have a handful or two of dried peas.</div>
                              <div class="line">But, I pray you, let none of your people stir me: I</div>
                              <div class="line">have an exposition of sleep come upon me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TITANIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Sleep thou, and I will wind thee in my arms.</div>
                              <div class="line">Fairies, begone, and be all ways away.</div>
                              <p>Exeunt fairies</p>
                              <div class="line">So doth the woodbine the sweet honeysuckle</div>
                              <div class="line">Gently entwist; the female ivy so</div>
                              <div class="line">Enrings the barky fingers of the elm.</div>
                              <div class="line">O, how I love thee! how I dote on thee!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>They sleep</p>
                        <p>Enter PUCK</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">OBERON</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Advancing</span>  Welcome, good Robin.</div>
                              <div class="line">See'st thou this sweet sight?</div>
                              <div class="line">Her dotage now I do begin to pity:</div>
                              <div class="line">For, meeting her of late behind the wood,</div>
                              <div class="line">Seeking sweet favours from this hateful fool,</div>
                              <div class="line">I did upbraid her and fall out with her;</div>
                              <div class="line">For she his hairy temples then had rounded</div>
                              <div class="line">With a coronet of fresh and fragrant flowers;</div>
                              <div class="line">And that same dew, which sometime on the buds</div>
                              <div class="line">Was wont to swell like round and orient pearls,</div>
                              <div class="line">Stood now within the pretty flowerets' eyes</div>
                              <div class="line">Like tears that did their own disgrace bewail.</div>
                              <div class="line">When I had at my pleasure taunted her</div>
                              <div class="line">And she in mild terms begg'd my patience,</div>
                              <div class="line">I then did ask of her her changeling child;</div>
                              <div class="line">Which straight she gave me, and her fairy sent</div>
                              <div class="line">To bear him to my bower in fairy land.</div>
                              <div class="line">And now I have the boy, I will undo</div>
                              <div class="line">This hateful imperfection of her eyes:</div>
                              <div class="line">And, gentle Puck, take this transformed scalp</div>
                              <div class="line">From off the head of this Athenian swain;</div>
                              <div class="line">That, he awaking when the other do,</div>
                              <div class="line">May all to Athens back again repair</div>
                              <div class="line">And think no more of this night's accidents</div>
                              <div class="line">But as the fierce vexation of a dream.</div>
                              <div class="line">But first I will release the fairy queen.</div>
                              <div class="line">Be as thou wast wont to be;</div>
                              <div class="line">See as thou wast wont to see:</div>
                              <div class="line">Dian's bud o'er Cupid's flower</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath such force and blessed power.</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, my Titania; wake you, my sweet queen.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TITANIA</div>
                              <div class="line">My Oberon! what visions have I seen!</div>
                              <div class="line">Methought I was enamour'd of an ass.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">OBERON</div>
                              <div class="line">There lies your love.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TITANIA</div>
                              <div class="line">How came these things to pass?</div>
                              <div class="line">O, how mine eyes do loathe his visage now!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">OBERON</div>
                              <div class="line">Silence awhile. Robin, take off this head.</div>
                              <div class="line">Titania, music call; and strike more dead</div>
                              <div class="line">Than common sleep of all these five the sense.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TITANIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Music, ho! music, such as charmeth sleep!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Music, still</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PUCK</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, when thou wakest, with thine</div>
                              <div class="line">own fool's eyes peep.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">OBERON</div>
                              <div class="line">Sound, music! Come, my queen, take hands with me,</div>
                              <div class="line">And rock the ground whereon these sleepers be.</div>
                              <div class="line">Now thou and I are new in amity,</div>
                              <div class="line">And will to-morrow midnight solemnly</div>
                              <div class="line">Dance in Duke Theseus' house triumphantly,</div>
                              <div class="line">And bless it to all fair prosperity:</div>
                              <div class="line">There shall the pairs of faithful lovers be</div>
                              <div class="line">Wedded, with Theseus, all in jollity.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PUCK</div>
                              <div class="line">Fairy king, attend, and mark:</div>
                              <div class="line">I do hear the morning lark.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">OBERON</div>
                              <div class="line">Then, my queen, in silence sad,</div>
                              <div class="line">Trip we after the night's shade:</div>
                              <div class="line">We the globe can compass soon,</div>
                              <div class="line">Swifter than the wandering moon.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TITANIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, my lord, and in our flight</div>
                              <div class="line">Tell me how it came this night</div>
                              <div class="line">That I sleeping here was found</div>
                              <div class="line">With these mortals on the ground.</div>
                              <p>Exeunt</p>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Horns winded within</p>
                        <p>Enter THESEUS, HIPPOLYTA, EGEUS, and train</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">THESEUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Go, one of you, find out the forester;</div>
                              <div class="line">For now our observation is perform'd;</div>
                              <div class="line">And since we have the vaward of the day,</div>
                              <div class="line">My love shall hear the music of my hounds.</div>
                              <div class="line">Uncouple in the western valley; let them go:</div>
                              <div class="line">Dispatch, I say, and find the forester.</div>
                              <p>Exit an Attendant</p>
                              <div class="line">We will, fair queen, up to the mountain's top,</div>
                              <div class="line">And mark the musical confusion</div>
                              <div class="line">Of hounds and echo in conjunction.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HIPPOLYTA</div>
                              <div class="line">I was with Hercules and Cadmus once,</div>
                              <div class="line">When in a wood of Crete they bay'd the bear</div>
                              <div class="line">With hounds of Sparta: never did I hear</div>
                              <div class="line">Such gallant chiding: for, besides the groves,</div>
                              <div class="line">The skies, the fountains, every region near</div>
                              <div class="line">Seem'd all one mutual cry: I never heard</div>
                              <div class="line">So musical a discord, such sweet thunder.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">THESEUS</div>
                              <div class="line">My hounds are bred out of the Spartan kind,</div>
                              <div class="line">So flew'd, so sanded, and their heads are hung</div>
                              <div class="line">With ears that sweep away the morning dew;</div>
                              <div class="line">Crook-knee'd, and dew-lapp'd like Thessalian bulls;</div>
                              <div class="line">Slow in pursuit, but match'd in mouth like bells,</div>
                              <div class="line">Each under each. A cry more tuneable</div>
                              <div class="line">Was never holla'd to, nor cheer'd with horn,</div>
                              <div class="line">In Crete, in Sparta, nor in Thessaly:</div>
                              <div class="line">Judge when you hear. But, soft! what nymphs are these?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EGEUS</div>
                              <div class="line">My lord, this is my daughter here asleep;</div>
                              <div class="line">And this, Lysander; this Demetrius is;</div>
                              <div class="line">This Helena, old Nedar's Helena:</div>
                              <div class="line">I wonder of their being here together.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">THESEUS</div>
                              <div class="line">No doubt they rose up early to observe</div>
                              <div class="line">The rite of May, and hearing our intent,</div>
                              <div class="line">Came here in grace our solemnity.</div>
                              <div class="line">But speak, Egeus; is not this the day</div>
                              <div class="line">That Hermia should give answer of her choice?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EGEUS</div>
                              <div class="line">It is, my lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">THESEUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Go, bid the huntsmen wake them with their horns.</div>
                              <p>Horns and shout within. LYSANDER, DEMETRIUS,
HELENA, and HERMIA wake and start up</p>
                              <div class="line">Good morrow, friends. Saint Valentine is past:</div>
                              <div class="line">Begin these wood-birds but to couple now?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LYSANDER</div>
                              <div class="line">Pardon, my lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">THESEUS</div>
                              <div class="line">I pray you all, stand up.</div>
                              <div class="line">I know you two are rival enemies:</div>
                              <div class="line">How comes this gentle concord in the world,</div>
                              <div class="line">That hatred is so far from jealousy,</div>
                              <div class="line">To sleep by hate, and fear no enmity?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LYSANDER</div>
                              <div class="line">My lord, I shall reply amazedly,</div>
                              <div class="line">Half sleep, half waking: but as yet, I swear,</div>
                              <div class="line">I cannot truly say how I came here;</div>
                              <div class="line">But, as I think,--for truly would I speak,</div>
                              <div class="line">And now do I bethink me, so it is,--</div>
                              <div class="line">I came with Hermia hither: our intent</div>
                              <div class="line">Was to be gone from Athens, where we might,</div>
                              <div class="line">Without the peril of the Athenian law.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">EGEUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Enough, enough, my lord; you have enough:</div>
                              <div class="line">I beg the law, the law, upon his head.</div>
                              <div class="line">They would have stolen away; they would, Demetrius,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thereby to have defeated you and me,</div>
                              <div class="line">You of your wife and me of my consent,</div>
                              <div class="line">Of my consent that she should be your wife.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DEMETRIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">My lord, fair Helen told me of their stealth,</div>
                              <div class="line">Of this their purpose hither to this wood;</div>
                              <div class="line">And I in fury hither follow'd them,</div>
                              <div class="line">Fair Helena in fancy following me.</div>
                              <div class="line">But, my good lord, I wot not by what power,--</div>
                              <div class="line">But by some power it is,--my love to Hermia,</div>
                              <div class="line">Melted as the snow, seems to me now</div>
                              <div class="line">As the remembrance of an idle gaud</div>
                              <div class="line">Which in my childhood I did dote upon;</div>
                              <div class="line">And all the faith, the virtue of my heart,</div>
                              <div class="line">The object and the pleasure of mine eye,</div>
                              <div class="line">Is only Helena. To her, my lord,</div>
                              <div class="line">Was I betroth'd ere I saw Hermia:</div>
                              <div class="line">But, like in sickness, did I loathe this food;</div>
                              <div class="line">But, as in health, come to my natural taste,</div>
                              <div class="line">Now I do wish it, love it, long for it,</div>
                              <div class="line">And will for evermore be true to it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">THESEUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Fair lovers, you are fortunately met:</div>
                              <div class="line">Of this discourse we more will hear anon.</div>
                              <div class="line">Egeus, I will overbear your will;</div>
                              <div class="line">For in the temple by and by with us</div>
                              <div class="line">These couples shall eternally be knit:</div>
                              <div class="line">And, for the morning now is something worn,</div>
                              <div class="line">Our purposed hunting shall be set aside.</div>
                              <div class="line">Away with us to Athens; three and three,</div>
                              <div class="line">We'll hold a feast in great solemnity.</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, Hippolyta.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt THESEUS, HIPPOLYTA, EGEUS, and train</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DEMETRIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">These things seem small and undistinguishable,</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HERMIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Methinks I see these things with parted eye,</div>
                              <div class="line">When every thing seems double.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                              <div class="line">So methinks:</div>
                              <div class="line">And I have found Demetrius like a jewel,</div>
                              <div class="line">Mine own, and not mine own.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DEMETRIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Are you sure</div>
                              <div class="line">That we are awake? It seems to me</div>
                              <div class="line">That yet we sleep, we dream. Do not you think</div>
                              <div class="line">The duke was here, and bid us follow him?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HERMIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Yea; and my father.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                              <div class="line">And Hippolyta.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LYSANDER</div>
                              <div class="line">And he did bid us follow to the temple.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DEMETRIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, then, we are awake: let's follow him</div>
                              <div class="line">And by the way let us recount our dreams.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BOTTOM</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Awaking</span>  When my cue comes, call me, and I will</div>
                              <div class="line">answer: my next is, 'Most fair Pyramus.' Heigh-ho!</div>
                              <div class="line">Peter Quince! Flute, the bellows-mender! Snout,</div>
                              <div class="line">the tinker! Starveling! God's my life, stolen</div>
                              <div class="line">hence, and left me asleep! I have had a most rare</div>
                              <div class="line">vision. I have had a dream, past the wit of man to</div>
                              <div class="line">say what dream it was: man is but an ass, if he go</div>
                              <div class="line">about to expound this dream. Methought I was--there</div>
                              <div class="line">is no man can tell what. Methought I was,--and</div>
                              <div class="line">methought I had,--but man is but a patched fool, if</div>
                              <div class="line">he will offer to say what methought I had. The eye</div>
                              <div class="line">of man hath not heard, the ear of man hath not</div>
                              <div class="line">seen, man's hand is not able to taste, his tongue</div>
                              <div class="line">to conceive, nor his heart to report, what my dream</div>
                              <div class="line">was. I will get Peter Quince to write a ballad of</div>
                              <div class="line">this dream: it shall be called Bottom's Dream,</div>
                              <div class="line">because it hath no bottom; and I will sing it in the</div>
                              <div class="line">latter end of a play, before the duke:</div>
                              <div class="line">peradventure, to make it the more gracious, I shall</div>
                              <div class="line">sing it at her death.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.6.3">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>2. SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter QUINCE, FLUTE, SNOUT, and STARVELING</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUINCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Have you sent to Bottom's house? is he come home yet?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">STARVELING</div>
                              <div class="line">He cannot be heard of. Out of doubt he is</div>
                              <div class="line">transported.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FLUTE</div>
                              <div class="line">If he come not, then the play is marred: it goes</div>
                              <div class="line">not forward, doth it?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUINCE</div>
                              <div class="line">It is not possible: you have not a man in all</div>
                              <div class="line">Athens able to discharge Pyramus but he.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FLUTE</div>
                              <div class="line">No, he hath simply the best wit of any handicraft</div>
                              <div class="line">man in Athens.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUINCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Yea and the best person too; and he is a very</div>
                              <div class="line">paramour for a sweet voice.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FLUTE</div>
                              <div class="line">You must say 'paragon:' a paramour is, God bless us,</div>
                              <div class="line">a thing of naught.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter SNUG</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SNUG</div>
                              <div class="line">Masters, the duke is coming from the temple, and</div>
                              <div class="line">there is two or three lords and ladies more married:</div>
                              <div class="line">if our sport had gone forward, we had all been made</div>
                              <div class="line">men.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FLUTE</div>
                              <div class="line">O sweet bully Bottom! Thus hath he lost sixpence a</div>
                              <div class="line">day during his life; he could not have 'scaped</div>
                              <div class="line">sixpence a day: an the duke had not given him</div>
                              <div class="line">sixpence a day for playing Pyramus, I'll be hanged;</div>
                              <div class="line">he would have deserved it: sixpence a day in</div>
                              <div class="line">Pyramus, or nothing.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter BOTTOM</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BOTTOM</div>
                              <div class="line">Where are these lads? where are these hearts?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUINCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Bottom! O most courageous day! O most happy hour!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BOTTOM</div>
                              <div class="line">Masters, I am to discourse wonders: but ask me not</div>
                              <div class="line">what; for if I tell you, I am no true Athenian. I</div>
                              <div class="line">will tell you every thing, right as it fell out.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUINCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Let us hear, sweet Bottom.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
